A lovely place to unwind, have a cocktail or a coffee with a delicious slice of cake.

For the 7th time in Belgrade, we went to this place. We usually stay at the Moskva Hotel, so we have breakfast, always excellent to the sound of the piano. The restaurant in the evening is excellent it remains a must in Belgrade. This year we were just passing through one day, we just wanted to have an aperitif around 5pm before returning, always nice, the setting did not move, we were even invited by the waiter to repatriate us inside because of the bad weather. So far everything is in line with the excellence of the place but when paying, for the first time, we were clearly asked "how much do you tip?" I find it rude, rude, vulgar and totally inappropriate for a place of such a high standing. Especially since we always leave something. So the Directorate please, if you read this notice, change this practice, give instructions to your staff
This place had excellent food and deserts. It is a little more expensive than a regular restaurant, but well-worth it. I would definitely eat here again.

We stayed at Hotel Moskva for 3 nights. Their buffet breakfast at this cafe was good with a variety of choices. However, dinner wasnt that good. Yes, it was innovative and picture worthy but definitely lacking in flavor. Also, we had gone back on our last night to try their famous Schnitte cake. Not only were we disappointed with the taste, the service was appallingly disappointing! There were at least 4 waiters within our proximity and they simply ignored us. Whats with that? They are in the hospitality business and they didnt bother to please their customers! I would never go back here.
This is a very upscale hotel with a lovely atmosphere. They have a nice area to enjoy coffee and delicious cakes and drinks. At times they have a pianist performing with lovely music.
"Tchaikovsky Hall" of Hotel Moskva - ideal space and unforgettable service

"Tchaikovsky Hall" of Hotel Moskva - ideal space and unforgettable service  After looking for a space (it took more than a month) in the wider part of the center of Belgrade where we would organize our son's wedding for about 20-30 guests, we were pleasantly surprised that the renowned Hotel Moskva has just such a space and service.  It is about the freshly restored "CHAIKOVSKY HALL WITH FIREPLACE ROOM", for guests who prefer intimate celebrations (weddings, baptisms, banquets, business events, etc.) and who require a separate space, a relaxed atmosphere similar to "home". In contrast to the 8 spaces (renowned restaurants and hotels) we looked at, the concept provided by the "Tchaikovsky Hall" is incomparable: a separate space with "French Louis eneterier", natural ventilation and a toilet, allows complete intimacy and relaxation in the very center of Belgrade.  The food is high-quality, fresh, abundant enough, tasty and prepared according to the highest gastronomic standards (combination of local and French cuisine). Meat, fish and vegetarian menu sets without fail, so that even the biggest hedonists (and almost everyone present was that in their own way) could not find the slightest complaint. One guest, a well-known lawyer from London, summed up her impression as follows: "I have almost never seen such a symbiosis of interior, food and service". At the same time, the "price of the service" is quite measured and acceptable, considering the overall quality of the service provided to us.  The waiters are rarely professional, decent, cultured, as if they were part of our family.  However, above all, we were surprised by the professionalism of Jovana Jovovi (Sales Coordinator), who organized it all. I am almost 70 years old, I have stayed for business and privately in dozens of prestigious hotels around the world and in all renowned restaurants and hotels in Bosnia and Herzegovina, but I have not had the opportunity to meet such commitment to work and clients, decency, helpfulness and trust that radiates from Jovana Jovovi.  All in all, respect for Hotel Moskva and its staff, with whom we spent time on January 29 of this year.
Fine dining, fine menu, nice location, piano live music, a fine atmosphere with good staff, I wooul like to come back

I went here with a friend during summer, and we ended up buying a late breakfast here. The food was great, and the atmosphere even greater. Even the decorations and the place itself was beautiful. The staff was very professional, and the food came rather quickly.

Went there with family and colleagues, service was extremely slow. Waiter approached us 20 minutes after we first sat. We ordered, waited 1 hour for drinks and another 30 minutes for our burgers to arrive (15e per burger), only to receive it cold. 15e for cold burger is a disgrace. I dont blame the waiters tho, this place is horribly understaffed! Employe more people if you charge that much! Never going there again.

Dear Safari57081952526, Thank you for taking the time and effort to post your review. From your feedback we realize that you did not enjoy fully your stay at our restaurant. As this is not what we strive to achieve, please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience we have caused you. Rest assured that your comments have been brought to the attention of the concerned department head for necessary action to be carried out. We hope that the misgiving experienced will not hinder you from considering visit us again as we look forward to welcoming you back to the Hotel Moskva and restauran Tchaikovsky in the nearest future, to regain your confidence in our service. Sincerely yours, Hotel Moskva team

This restaurant located Terazije square is at a prime location and the oldest operating hotel in city since 1906. Beautiful ambience and great food. We ordered vegan burger, risottoand grape wine. The food was great and vegetarian options were available.

I have been rather disappointed on the quality of the food. I had Beef tartare as cold starter and what was supposed to be Risotto with smoked duct breast. I probably got food poisoning due to the beef tartare which was not served cold and fresh.  The risotto was really not good. It was crispy - not cooked enough - and bot at all creamy!   So disappointed

I often have my evening meal at the Hotel Moscow since the atmosphere and cuisine is unmatched in the city centre. I eat out every night, and this hotel has by far the most refined experience:  From 6 to 8pm there's a pianist playing really nice tunes and this really adds to the atmosphere. The waiters are top notch, and the wine selection is always excellent. So in this hotel they offer the best Serbian wines and they match the cuisine well.   The kitchen has a new chef apparently, and the food is rich and tasty.

Nice place to have a glass of wine, champagne, afternoon tea....they have a big choice of cakes and sweets.  I will say the prices for Serbia are not cheap but the location is worth it.  The service was nice and polite.   The service was nice and polite.  I picked the cake made under the name of the hotel, according to the hotel Is unique in the world.... not bad but not amazing.. must be because im chocoholic

We heard about the history of this hotel on a free walking tour and came back for the famous Moscow cake (and others) and coffee. It is a little more spendy then other cafes but surprisingly affordable. The quality of the coffee and cakes were great and the ambiance very special. Service was good. Lovely history/ A nice place to spend an hour.
Lovely coffe while listening piano play in background , had tastyest breakfast sandwich ever, traditional and well visited place by all generations

Great restaurant and great location. It was easy to find it since it is located in the city center. Delicious and tasty food, served by highly pleasant staff. I recommend this place to all who need a quiet and comfortable place for having lunch with your family.

This is the version of our website addressed to speakers of English in the United States. If you are a resident of another country or region, please select the appropriate version of Tripadvisor for your country or region in the drop-down menu.
By mistake the review i wrote for ambar is for madera restaurant. I really appologize for the mistake please dont publish it thanks

It was pretty, we went family, we said tasting menu, the flavors were good, Turkish dish was perfectly suited to tasting menu, you can request your desired food again without any additional cost. The ambience is pretty friendly and they understand clean English and I think its a place to choose

A nice restaurant with good food, excellent service, and a warm, inviting atmosphere.  It was a very nice stop on our walking tour around the river. The place is very cosy and in good location The food was good with couple of tasty dishes the staff were friendly and attentive. recommended

We came to Ambar after reading countless glowing reviews, expecting a special dining experience with their all you can eat menu. Unfortunately, it turned out to be one of the most disappointing meals of our trip. The dishes arrived in a messy order, many of them were dry, poorly prepared, and simply not tasty. It felt as if the food was brought out just to tick a box, without any real care or attention. Even after we told the waitress that we barely touched most of the dishes, no one tried to understand what went wrong or offer any kind of solution. After seeing so many positive reviews, we expected something completely different. Sadly, it was far from it. We wont be coming back, and we definitely cant recommend it.
Definitely the best place in town. Excellent service, excellent food, and we will always be happy to return. I would especially single out the location, with a beautiful view of the river.

Our Trafalgar group had its Farewell Dinner here on Oct 11. Beautiful setting on the river, an old warehouse refurbished into a wonderful restaurant. I had a delicious soup, lovely tomato and cucumber salad, amazing sausage and fries and then chocolate cake. Everything was great including the service and atmosphere.
Poor Service, The food worst we ate during our stay in Belgrade. Arrogant staff Small portions  And not worth the money. Had high expectations but unfortunately nothing I can recommend.
Very delicious and varied menu. We chose the unlimited menu and loved it. Somewhat expensive for Serbian standards but still absolutely top!

We arrive that the place was not at all crowded, very few presences. Let's order two seconds and a side dish. One of the main courses, a fried chicken, arrives almost immediately. Time goes by and the rest of the food doesn't show. It is good practice for diners to eat together, I understand that it is difficult to deliver 10 courses together but there were two of us and we ordered three dishes.  I wait more than 5 minutes, during which obviously the food was cooling, I look for the waiter but he was busy chatting in the kitchen (open kitchen, so all visible). Alche I get up and go to the register to report. He apologizes and goes to check. After several minutes the appetizer arrives and then others pass by to have the Third Party dish. Needless to say, in the meantime my chicken had totally cooled off. I report the discontent and the waiter tells me that the food comes out when it is ready. Okay, so make sure it's ready for everyone at the same time, not in stages.  Good food, thankfully. Let's order coffee. I have time to go to the bathroom, come back, wait, observe the staff who should make our coffee mind their business with their cellphone, and we decide to go and ask at the counter. The waiter had forgotten...I wonder what happens when the place is full. Of course I won't find out because they won't see me again.

Amazing experience. Small plates, big laughs. The food was amazing, really flavorful. A tad bit more expensive, but actually a very reasonable price for the quality. Would recommend all the way if you want a proper gastro experience of Serbian cousine.

Ambar  Belgrade  Weak expectations  1024064191  He was a slave to our expectations. Very expensive for Serbia. Arrogant waiters. Do not specify small or big portion on the menu. Although we finished eating, it didn't even take our dirty plates from the front until we paid.

Not very busy for lunch, but had a great table outside (we were still cool). Service by Ivica was effortlessly, the (partly shared) food was fresh and very nice. Ivica's suggestion to try a local white wine: Blejk Chichateau was suprising. Good lunch had by all!
Nice food in very small portions The space outside full of insects on the ceiling

The food tastefully was very careful but it was very small in quantity and the price quite sour. For families with children I would not recommend it. The location of the tables outside with insects on the ceiling something that became tedious after they fell on our plates
The ambiance, food, waitress , view all was excellent. Although little less options for Veggie persons but whatever they have were really good
We had dinner by the river experiencing a serbian menu that had almost everything! And tasty! I think the beef carpaccio was the best

This is the version of our website addressed to speakers of English in the United States. If you are a resident of another country or region, please select the appropriate version of Tripadvisor for your country or region in the drop-down menu.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: The downside of this restaurant is that they smoke here. The main pros are great service, fast meals, live music, large portions and delicious food

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: Their food was excellent, but not perfect. The communications were very weak and not taken care of. The vibe is so beautifully self-sufficient. There were individual players on every floor and section. Music starts after 9 p.m. We had a Reservation for 8:00, but we thought we'd cancel until the music started. The gamers who came to our floor were friendly and entertained. I dont choose again because there was a non-cozy attitude.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: Very large and a bit dark (you can hardly see the dishes). Service so fast and quick that they brought us appetizers and meat dishes all together. Already not hot we ate them almost cold. The equally cold crepe is undercooked. There are better restaurants

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: While in Belgrade it was almost compulsory to have a dinner in the Skardarlija Quarter at Dva Jelena (Two Deers, established in 1832)  a HUGE multi level restaurant. They say that the Serbian national salad is MEAT! We had plenty to eat, with a drink of rocket fuel (Rakija) to start with. We were warned that it could be smoky  the locals love to smoke, however we ended up down & around & down in a private dining room, (Flambe) with drinks, food & music  and NO SMOKE. Good service, food, great music & singer.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: This hostess is driving customers away and is a complete liability to the business. We traveled from Greece with a reservation made a week in advance, yet no one bothered to mention a "dress code." Its honestly laughable; we have visited the most high-end restaurants across Europe and were always treated with respect, yet this outdated place in Belgrade had an issue with us being "well-dressed." Even after we were seated, the hostess approached us with an incredibly aggressive and rude attitude. She showed zero respect for a member of our party recovering from surgery, staying hostile and dismissive. Its a joke to judge guests so inconsistently when other people inside were poorly dressed. Her toxic behavior ruins the restaurant's reputation. Save yourself the trouble and go elsewhere.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: The location and long-standing reputation of this restaurant are not in question. However, non-smokers should avoid it. Friendly staff and good food cannot compensate for the overwhelming cigarette smoke. I believe the experience is much more pleasant in the summer, when sitting outside in the garden.  The space is very small, and tables are simply declared as smoking or non-smoking, without any physical separation. In reality, the entire restaurant is filled with cigarette smoke.  For a non-smoker, having lunch or dinner here feels like inhaling the equivalent of a full pack of cigarettes per meal, making it impossible to enjoy the atmosphere of a traditional old Belgrade restaurant. This place is clearly suitable only for smokers.  It is especially not recommended for families or couples with children.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: This used to be a bohemian restaurant, but now is a place of horror where several bands interfere each other, food is overpriced and at doors you have peasant girls with no manners. It's sad to see what DvaJelena became.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: Not good!  Slow service and the tasty not very good. The typical Pljeskavlca taste industrial meat. I had in anotehet place really good.

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: we arrived around 730 on a monday night, and it was already crowded, they stuck us in the far back with all the tourists at a table with absolutely no leg room whatsover. The ribs we ordered were luke warm to cold, ,, the service was terrible. Ive been to Dva jelena once before five years ago, during the day when there were no people and the service and food were good.. But this time, the food was absolutely terrible,, I paid $125 for a terrible dinner.. was a waste of money

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: Great location, great value, great food, great portions genuine and local. Really recommend this gem in Belgrade

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: Huge place with several levels; we were taken to a dark lower level. The food is traditional Serbian fare, with lots of meat. We had chicken, kebabs, burgers, potatoes, and cake. All too much!

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: As tourists we took a walk down the street and accidentally went into this restaurant, turned to the waiter asking for a table for 4 people she pointed to a certain table, we started to settle down, (I notice we don't know Serbian - communication in English) , another completely waiter comes up to us and asks us if we were spared the table, we said "no" as soon as we came in and he told us in reply that we can't sit at this table, but we tell him that it's our vessels directed by the waiters (he abruptly stopped speaking in English) and passed by that waiter and we spared him and he said that he directed us to this table, we sat down and opened the menu but the menu unfortunately in Serbian and it's hard for us, we decided to check if they had a menu in English, one of several old people (waiters) passed by we respectfully called him to ask a question to which he waved off and looked rudely at us, we said we only wanted to ask a question to which he rudely answered wait for his waiter and then we were carried, I was in many restaurants in Serbia but this one is not worth it!! Within 5 minutes I felt owed someone a favor to wait and beg....sorry ...but this isn't a restaurant this is a diner!!!!

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: Great choice  In the center of Belgrade, in a characteristic area, a stop for a great typical lunch.  Clean room, friendly and caring staff, generous portions and very good quality

Restoran: Dva Jelena The Two Deer Restaurant
Recenzija: This is the version of our website addressed to speakers of English in the United States. If you are a resident of another country or region, please select the appropriate version of Tripadvisor for your country or region in the drop-down menu.
Is it possible to book a table somehow? I sent a message to email, but nobody replied(
It's very nice place to have dinner and some rest and it is very good food and lifestyle of time and just very good friends and their are all very good
Thank you for review. We don't understand why the rating is 3 if the food is nice and good place?  We wish you all the best.

We went to iribu iriba for lunch on my last day of this visit to Serbia. In fact we had intended to go to a different restaurant but found that it was closed on Mondays. iribu iriba was a lucky discovery! It is a fine restaurant in the centre of Zemun, in a splendid old building with old pictures of the town and artefacts to match. There was a very pleasant atmosphere about the place.  The menu offers a much eider range of traditional Serbian dishes than many other restaurants. As soon as we arrived we were offered a spoonful of slatko, a Serbian tradition that I have experienced in private homes before but not in a restaurant. For my main course I had sarma, meat wrapped in pickled cabbage leaves, which was delicious. We didn't have time for a dessert and didn't want rakija, wine or beer as we had some other things to do before my flight back to the UK later in the afternoon. However, we will certainly return for a fuller meal on my next visit which I hope will be next spring.  The waiter was very pleasant and helpful, and willing to engage with my limited knowledge of the Serbian language which I really appreciated. By the way, the curious name of the restaurant means something like "abracadabra". It was a truly magical experience!

Typical and picturesque restaurant at the same time. Very Good Welcoming. The restaurant room and its covered terrace charmed us.  We feasted and at a more than reasonable price. The slatk spoon at the beginning of the meal as tradition and the very well dressed and charming waiters.  Too bad we got mixed up with the smokers...
A really interesting restaurant with a super interesting menu, lots of local choices. I had a Serbian wine which was great and a stuffed chicken, the portion was certainly plentiful!
We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit! Thank you for choosing us, and for this great review! All the best, and many regards from our team!

Very pleasant team of professionals, one of the best experiences city wide so far. I will certainly visit this restaurant again - the food is excellent and served fast despite the crowd, the waiters have a profound knowledge of the menu and recommend the most delicious combinations available.
Traditional restaurant in the center of Zemun, very nice atmosphere, good cuisine, good value for money. I'll go back.

Everything was perfect. Portions were big, the food was delicious, the atmosphere was amazing and the staff were very helpful and nice. Must visit place in Zemun if you want to experience the culture.

We went for dinner with my husband one main course Royal Turkey one steak chicken juice soup bread 3250 Dinars we paid about 1170 TL. They gave us trickers and it was exquisite. The food was delicious and 2 people could get enough of the over-satisfied Royal Turkey. The ambience was very comfortable, traditionally designed, and the employees were very friendly. Its definitely a place to try. Great bottom for head relaxation, a good choice for afternoon dining
We are so happy to hear you enjoyed our restaurant. Thank you for visiting us and for these kind words! All the best from our team!
We have been coming to this restaurant for years. And we can say that its quality is constantly growing. We ate grilled cheese, rolled prines and kebab  Avram ;)   Amazing
Very nice place, cosy and friendly environment, the staff was very helpful and the service was fine. Above all the food is sth you MUST try.  A place to be as long as you visit belgrade
Place is very nice, atmosphere and food is delicious.. waither is also kind and helpful..i give very huge recommended..for sure i will come again

My honest opinion is that the restaurant is excellent. The food is delicious, the service is excellent, kudos to the staff. The ambiance is excellent, and the menu is extensive, offering something for everyone

We were nicely received with sweet quince and water, old Serbian custom, and ordered our food. After waiting for some time turn out they completely forgot our order! It was just a few tables occupied  finely we got food but my wine was forgotten. Weird experience, nevertheless food was phenomenal.
We dont understand this review. You write that the food was phenomenal? And after that you give rate 3? ;)))  We wish you all the best.

Extremely slow in service, there are few staff and they take it easy, but both the local (you can smoke ), and in service, as well as the quality of the food, is of high QUALITY. Recommended in this small neighborhood next to Belgrade. Especially the fish.
Atmoshere is excellent.  Barbecue perfect, we eat lamb chops and sausage.  We want to praise service.  They have livw music on saturday, we must try that.

This is the version of our website addressed to speakers of English in the United States. If you are a resident of another country or region, please select the appropriate version of Tripadvisor for your country or region in the drop-down menu.
Nice restaurant, pleasant and cordial staff but the food was bellow average. Tasteless and burnt. Overall, the quality of the food fell well below expectations.
Excellent The staff and of course the dishes.  We love to eat out if you are lovers of truffles it must be done

I know this restaurant and when we go to Belgrade it is always among our favorites an excellent restaurant excellent menu choice and ditto for the wine list, very professional staff a fair value for money. Oh, congratulations.
Great food. In the center so you can wisit the park after to go on a walk. Fancy with amaizing dishes. I reccomend booking in advance
Very professional Welcoming and server The meat dish a delight as our starter and dessert  It's the second time we've come and still as good
Had occasional visit there with family and friends. Tried only limonades/tea/coffee and desserts. Absolutely satisfied. Will consider visiting again whenever happen to be nearby.

It used to be a much better restaurant. It seems that the prices have almost doubled within one year and the service has gone down. Now it is very overpriced and not worth it. If you sit in the garden it's nice on a nice summer night, but when we were there the garden was closed, and inside it's like an ordinary restaurant. Overall, now it's very overpriced and not worth it. It's a pity because I used to think that this is the best restaurant in Belgrade.
Rude guest not respecting old people with disability, using offensive language and ageism. The staff was not helpful. They all seemed self-absorbed. I will not be returning to that place again.
2nd time and great expirience againVery good restorant. Amazing food and pleasant team. I will recommend to my friends
Beautiful restaurant , perfect in everything , with great food and extremely reasonable bill, unimaginable in Italy

A perfect place for a romantic dinner. Chic place, cozy atmosphere, staff attentive to your needs. We followed the recommendations for the choice of starters, they were excellent and local. The dishes and wines were also of high quality. A local digestive was offered to us (Bermet). We recommend this place.

uring my visit to Belgrade, I had the pleasure of dining at Madera, one of the citys most renowned restaurants. Located in the heart of the capital, near Tamajdan Park, Madera offers a perfect blend of elegance, history, and exceptional cuisine.

Idyll in the truest sense of the word  a place that embodies everything the term can symbolize. Perfect for true gourmets and hedonists who know how to enjoy food at the highest level. There were six of us, and each person had their own personal waiter who carefully served the food. At places like this, price is not the question  youre there to surrender to the flavors and enjoy good company. In the end, everyone carefully helped us put on our coats, and as a finishing touch, we were greeted with a mint candy at the exit, which has a soothing effect on the stomach and can help alleviate bloating after a hearty meal.
Very beautiful place. Pleasant and polite staff.  In my opinion the ratio of price and quality would be better but what we ate was ok.
The service was very polite and quick. The food was delicious too. The ambience is convenient for dining in style. Reservations may be required.

This is the version of our website addressed to speakers of English in the United States. If you are a resident of another country or region, please select the appropriate version of Tripadvisor for your country or region in the drop-down menu.
May not be proper for business dinner if it starts later in the evening. too little food
Hello, is the price written next to the 7-course menu in your current menu the Serbian dinar price?
The environment is beautiful but is definitely not value for money place. I asked for the vegetarian 5 meal course and I was very disappointed. Out of the 5 plates in noted only the two.
A restaurant where every moment feels like a feast  absolutely the best in its field!

I got proposed to here! Everything was unbelievably beautiful, thank you so, so much. The ambiance and the food were amazing! The staff's hospitality and warmth were beyond perfect! They had even closed the restaurant just for us. We had a tasting experience in our own language with the help of AI to better understand the dishes, which was such a thoughtful touch. On top of that, the 'traditional bread' story they came up with for the proposal made it truly unforgettable. It was the most romantic moment of our engagement. Thank you especially for that, too. From A to Z, we experienced top quality and incredible flavors. And a special thank you to the gentleman who personally took care of us. With love :)

Such sn amazing experience- elegant setting in a stunning building with beautiful background music playing. Service was outstanding- all the waiting staff highly professional & special praise for tye somelier too who was spot on with his recommendations   The tasting menu was high quality. Interesting dishes that were a creative spark to traditional serbian cuisine - all really tasty & enjoyable.  Its expensive. But its not just a dinner, its an evening experience much like going to the theatre. Highly recommend this & it is worth paying the money for. Enjoy

My experience at Salon 1905 in Belgrade was disappointing. The service was slow, and the staff seemed unprofessional. The atmosphere didnt live up to expectations, and overall, it was not worth the visit. I wouldnt recommend it. 1 star.

This is a unique place, and that is something we must always take into account. Since that way we can better understand the experience itself. What is the uniqueness of this place?, is to try to sell an elegance and exclusive treatment and from another period, although I do not think it will succeed.   We will find different closed menu options, in our case it was a seven course menu with wine for 210 per head. In the reservation you are told a small "dress code" that later seen is not fulfilled, and this would be the first hit, if you ask something enforce it, if not directly obvious the request.   The salon is simply spectacular, the service very correct perhaps for my taste somewhat invasive, and within it The sommelier is perhaps his loosest point in this field, not so much for his knowledge, which I am sure are ample if not for the forms, slightly patronizing.   The food being so wide menu becomes paused and elongated , without saturating the elaborations are well executed , with some that stand out over the others. But you will not find anything memorable, or that will make you come back when you return to Belgrade, once lived the experience has no hook to return to it.   Whether you are thinking about coming or not, I recommend going is going to be a unique experience at a high but affordable cost. But I'm telling you there's nothing beyond that to make you come back or remember the visit.   It takes the four stars although perhaps it is closer to three....

Fantastic feeling, we felt very special. Our children got an additional dessert with "children-friendly" mochito from the main chef. The stuff was very pleasant and well educated about all meals and wines. We got cards about every dish that we got served. The enviroment was beutiful and inspiring as well, but the best was the main chef's creativity. The food was delicious!

Very weird experience. Business dinner with customer, 6 people, we chose a course of 5 dishes + wine paring. Started at 6pm after intense working day and no food. Even with a compliment from the house - a tiny kebab, we stayed hungry. Portions over tiny, mixed tastes and colours and unclear choice of sequence. At the same time, too much cheap local wine (Aleksandrovic, Radovanovic, Kisch - easy find at any supermarket) - mixed sparkling, white and red and Bermet at the end. Bottom line - yes, fine dining, but they overdid it, too little food vs too much suspicious wine = stomach problems for most guests and terrible headache for alcohol. The bill was over 1000 EUR. We ended up at a hotel restaurant to fill ourselves in.  One more thing - the place is tiny in fact, if most tables are occupied with guests, it is hard to imagine what it would feel like in terms of talking, and listening to each other.

Spectacular ambience, well-trained and attentive staff, interesting and artsy culinary, fine dining experience at a most reasonable price (compared to other establishments in Europe and the US). If theres something to point out would be the attire of the sommelier (I believe it would be best to put on a more appropriate suit so as to be in harmony with the general atmosphere of the surroundings).

We had the 5 course menu: - portions too small, we were still hungry after the 5 courses - Almost nothing crunchy or hot, in all the dishes we find emulsions and espuma.. - 70 euros more for the food and wine assortment, the sommelier does not provide any explanation on the wines. Besides, the glasses are only half full, even though we pay full price - The waiters speak quickly like robots, we don't understand the explanations  Way too expensive, tasteless, portions too small

My partner and I are living on a vegan diet but didn't wan't to miss the opportunity to dine at this beautiful location.  Within minutes after sending the restaurant a request per mail, I received a reply that they are happy to create a vegan menu for us!  The location was beautiful and the service outstanding! There was a 3 man live band playing great jazz and setting the right vibe. We got offered a 3 or a 5 course vegan menu. After a beautiful dinner the chef came to check on us and we had a nice little chat about his teams effort to create a outstanding vegan menu.  This was the best part of out weekend visit of Belgrade! Highly recommended!

We visited this restaurant with a couple of friends and we are all fully satisfied. The place is very nice and elegant, the food is fantastic and the staff are deeply professional. Our seven course menu lasted for three hours and all dishes were carefully presented also on a card which accompanied each course. It is definitely worth the visit. We all had a really good experience here.

A very beautiful building with a spectacular staircase that takes you into an impressive room, a little baroque but quite majestic The dishes are delicate and good. Excellent carpaccio, fantastic parmesan risotto and very good veal fillet. Some Serbian wines are up to standard, notably whites and roses Small downside with a rigid waiter who thinks he is a schoolmaster and takes the guests for kids.

Overall very dissapointing.   Firstly inside felt cold and the atmosphere was more like a funeral rather than a restaurant. The energy from front of house was pretentious.  The food was abysmal as well as the presentation. Meat overcooked and everything tasted bland.
My first real gourmet experience in Serbia. Top location, stylishly furnished, attentive staff, wine accompaniment perfectly matched to the food. You have to try it at least once.

I should not have given this restaurant another chance.   After my first disappointment in 2021 I decided to give 1905 another chance. Any restaurant can have a bad day, and I normally trust Michelin rating/mentions. This years visit started like last visit, the beautiful restaurant is inviting and creates expectations. But like last year the positive experience stopped there. Regular service that you dont expect on a restaurant at this price range in combination with pretentiously presented but badly executed food. This restaurant is for show off but not for foodies/gourmands. Belgrade has many good restaurants - but this one isnt.

This is the version of our website addressed to speakers of English in the United States. If you are a resident of another country or region, please select the appropriate version of Tripadvisor for your country or region in the drop-down menu.

We had a wonderful experience. Both the staff and the regular customers truly embraced us in every sense of the word as soon as they found out that we are Greek. The food was excellent, the atmosphere was warm and welcoming, and the place itself is a remarkable historical venue. An unforgettable experience that reflects genuine hospitality.
It is amazing!!! The place you have to go if you visit Beograd. Excellent food ,service, atmosphere.    .  !!!

Been there many times, all because good experience first couple of times. Now, every time I go, food and service are getting worse. Chewy meat, slow servers, completely not interested in customers. On my latest visit, drunk local guy was harassing Russian couple, sat at their table, servers did nothing. No sense of care for people visiting restaurant who is giving them paychecks. shame.
Love this place, the service and food are amazing. Always kind, professional with affordable prices. Must visit in Belgrade.

Cozy, Soviet style interior, good food, very reasonable prices. If you like it - this is your place; if you like something more luxury & snobbish - could be disappointed. Best of all - music after 9 pm; very nice, native, professional. Amazing how those musician playing in so crowd place. Enjoy!

a small restaurant, rather basic amenities and local Serbian cuisine. Prices are reasonable, atmosphere as far as okay . In the backyard, not quite easy to find. from 9:15 pm there was, good, live music (2 guitarists). Recommended, but not really outstanding
Thanks for the free apple! I like everything you do! Such a good soup you have! I hope we will be back soon! Hello for all from Korcagin! Kosovo is Serbia

I WAS THERE ON A VERY FALLEN JULY EVENING, CONVINCED BY THE GOOD REVIEWS I FOUND HERE, BUT ALAS I CAN'T REALLY SHARE THEM AVERAGE FOOD, THEY MADE US SIT IN A ROOM HALFWAY BETWEEN INDOORS AND OUTDOORS WHERE I THINK IT WAS OVER 30 DEGREES WITHOUT TELLING US THEY HAD A LOT OF FREE TABLES OUTSIDE, THEY WERE PROBABLY UNCOMFORTABLE SERVICE FOOD , I REPEAT, NOTHING PARTICULAR, AND THE MOST SERIOUS THING AT THE TIME OF THE ACCOUNT, THEY ASKED US HOW WE INTENDED TO PAY AND WHEN I SAID BY CARD, FIRST THEY PRETENDED THERE WAS NO LINE, IN THE END THEY ACCEPTED BY ADDING A SURCHARGE OF ABOUT 10 % ON THE ACCOUNT , INVENTING A STATE TAX, WHICH NOBODY ELSE HAS EVER ASKED US. There is no restaurant there. Maybe the address here is wrong there is an empty old restaurant store front, but no restaurant.

Be prepared for some service disappointments so that they do not spoil the enjoyment of food

If youre in Belgrade and craving a polished finedining experience with a quietly confident kitchen, Langoustes 8course tasting menu delivers a thoughtful arc of flavors, precise technique, and genuinely warm service. Expect elegant plating, clean flavors, and a few playful nods to regional ingredientscapped by a standout roasted duck and a whimsical Save the Bees dessert. My favorite foie gras course was silky, cool, and impeccably seasonedpaired with toasted brioche and a gently sweet fruit element (think quince or fig). The balance between richness, sweetness, and a touch of acidity is spoton.  My second best was roasted duck which was 24 hours cooked - if i remeber well. The skin is glasscrisp with a lacquered sheen; the meat remains undeniably rosy and tender. Accents lean savoryfruity.

Wonderful dinner, the tasting menu shows the whole palette of the chefs art, in the dishes we find a subtle mix of European and Serbian cuisine with a Japanese touch. The Serbian wines offered with the food and wine pairing are a great discovery, especially the whites and this muscat ros for dessert.  A thank you to our waiter who was able to bring the extra touch to enhance this meal.

A beautiful setting with food that I ran out of superlatives to describe half way through. My amazing waiter made the experience even more unforgettable. Cannot recommend highly enough. Highest praises to everyone involved. Just stunning

It is amazing that Belgrade and Serbia now have their first star restaurant. But it actually holds a goal. Had an eight-day menu that was simply hard to remember when one had eaten it. Most of it was good but not more than that, it lacked the Wow factor simply. The meal composite was in quantity large enough for most. There was emphasis on some local raw materials and that was good. But one can question the fact that serving a 15 days old diadem is sustainable. The locks are fine, the service pleasant and attentive. But price and quality are in my head not star quality. Compared to restuaranties with one star in Norway, a country with much higher costs than in Serbia, the price level is not very different. It may differ 30-40 euros on a menu. The number of bits, servings in Norway is also much higher and the quality and creativity correspond. For its own sake it was worth the money and the visit alone to be at the first star restaurant in Serbia. But the experience was well like buying and trying one of the worlds most expensive cheeses made of donkey milk and produced in Serbia. So the recommendation must be that you rather go to one of the many other excellent restaurants in Belgrade where you get more value for money. That being said, I wish Langouste luck with the further development of the restaurant and hope there will be more restaurants in Belgrade coming after. One must be the first and it was Langouste who won that award.

We had the chance to dine in this restaurant a few weeks after getting their 1st*Michelin. We were a great table of 6 people and we all dined " la carte". Meals excellent classic cuisine but extremely well executed. Perfect service and excellent wine list. The star is well deserved and the team will not stop there. The only cultural remark the room is smoking and I must say that it is very embarrassing for a meal of such quality.

It gives me no pleasure to rate it just 2 stars, because the food is actually quite good, but certain faux pas are just inexcusable for even a regular upscale restaurant, let alone a Michelin-starred one. I hope the mgmt. corrects these mistakes. First, they do not have any bubbly by the glass and push customers towards a demi-bottle for $55. They do have kir royale on the menu, but we were informed that "it was not available", and neither was any cocktail with champagne, prosecco, or any other bubbly! It was only after my strenuous objection and plain explanation that they could simply open a bottle and make the drink that they relented. The second foul was the fact that they only allow prix fixe (fine), the cheapest is just over 100eur (fine), but the bill added measly 500din (<$5) cover charge pp! How ridiculous! Guys, this is for cheap restaurants, so that people do not order a plate of french fries and sit there for 2 hrs, not when you already get 25x that much! If you must, charge 500din more for the prix fixe! Finally, they do not allow BYOB even with a corkage fee, which I also find in bad taste. The explanation was even worse: "the previous chef was entertaining his buddies and they would bring tons of wine and drink for free, hence the new policy..." Guys, charge even 50-100eur corkage fee, one bottle max pp, no wines from your own list, but allow customers who might celebrate a special moment to bring their special bottle that they have been saving for years for such an occasion!

Great view overlooking the Sava River. Definitely a special occasion place, with visitors dressed up and probably on dates. Michelin recommended (not starred). Fish and seafood focused. Option for tasting menu or a la carte. Expensive for Serbia but a good deal relative to comparable places elsewhere in Europe. They allow indoor smoking, but have a designated nonsmoking section and thankfully, no one was smoking the night we went.
Impeccable service, but on other hand rather empty. Perfect for formal meetings. Was seated near window so had opportunity to enjoy the perfect view of Danub and Sava river

We ate 2 times in Langouste during our week-long stay in Belgrade. At first, we came just with my wife and we ordered lobster menu. The lobster was prepared in 2 ways: with pasta and grilled with a bit of sauce and vegetables and we really enjoyed it. Introduction to the meal were 3 small and very interesting appetizers. Combined with uninterrupted views of Sava River, it was absolutely 5-stars, if I was making a review just based on the visit. But in 2 days we came back being 4 people already. We chose fish menu (which to my uneducated eye should be easier to perfect compared to lobster one), the restaurant agreed to adapt it a bit to our tastes and food preferences (my wife doesnt eat dishes from raw fish) and we definitely appreciated the flexibility. But for the main course we got John Dory  tasteless, hard and a bit over-burned. Again, to be fair, the restaurant charged us for 2 John Dory only  this is again appreciated, but I would have preferred to pay for all 4 dishes subject to everyone enjoying them. All in all, not a bad place, if you are up to Michelin restaurant style and prices. But afterwards we found a much better fish restaurant in Belgrade.

As a passionate visitor to the beautiful city of Belgrade, I have had Langouste on my "to go" list for a long time.  Now I have finally found my way there. Beautiful location with a wonderful view of the Sava River. The atmosphere in the restaurant is pleasant, but still has some potential. Sometimes it gives a somewhat sterile or empty impression.  I received four different amuse bouches, from a cornet with shiitake mushrooms to a puff pastry filled with Serbian cream cheese to a mushroom ragout to a brioche with truffle butter. The best brioche I have ever eaten. Excellent. And I was almost no longer hungry afterwards. :-)  For the starter there was fish carpaccio with thinly sliced beetroot, chestnuts, horseradish foam and an orange sauce. Very tasty and recommended.  For the main course I chose the beef fillet, which was also good. I have very high standards when it comes to meat, so unfortunately it doesn't come close to an excellent rating. The sauce and especially the side dish, a kind of creamy wheat peppered with fried duck liver, were top class.  All in all, a very tasty dinner with a wonderful view and excellent and friendly service.

Fantastic restaurant! A unique experience if you like culinary indulgence. A three-star chef originally from Paris, who came to Belgrade. Beautiful decor, wonderful views over the Danube and delicious, refined, tasty dishes matched with sublime matched local wines.

Our first time in Belgrade with my friend and we were recommended to visit Langouste restaurant, I have to say this place deserves all Michelin stars and our server name was Marco, he went above and beyond to make our first dinner in Belgrade so memorable! We were given the best table with a view and Marco surprised us with a few complimentary dishes and an amazing desert! Atmosphere is very private and super attentive staff. Marco made sure we had the best time and explained every dish so well, one of the most tasteful dishes we had was Rooster cooked in red wine sauce, fish carpaccio and lemon tart desert all recommended by Marco. Thanks for such an amazing evening we will remember this place and come back on our next visit to Belgrade.

Best restaurant we have been to in Serbia. Quality tasting menu with wine flight. Waiter provided excellent service and was culturally interesting to talk to. Based on UK prices fantastic value as well.
Top view and good service. The food preparation was great but the taste for a star restaurant was not meeting our expectations.

Excellent experience in Langouste Restaurant. High level in the cuisine was matched by excellent service. The selection of local products, the innovative cuisine and the and the relaxed atmosphere contributed to a memorable and enjoyable lunch. I inhibited a chef who works in a one star Michelin in France and he was impressed. Congrats to the team and to the Chef.

It is the triumph of paella in all its forms. Quality of fish , large portions , good service and value for money appropriate to the level of the place. Very rich menu in both meat and fish dishes. Great restaurant, maybe a bit overrated here on Tripadvisor. Paella ok, good wines. Serving straightforward, but maybe somewhat eccentric. For hot red wine, it became better after a walk in the refrigerator at the table.

Went on the reviews here and not disappointed. Really busy restaurant.  We had Delicious mixed paella Value for money  Good service

Mixed experience. Rice main dish was great....but starters were not good, tomato salad with non-fresh tomatoes, but the most annoying part was that the waiter didn't know anything about the menu....I wasn't expecting for a recommendation, but at least the basic ability to explain the difference between some dishes, something that he couldn't do. We didn't like the approach, the fact that food was rushed, that once we finish eating we were pushed either to order a dessert or leave (even though we still had more than 40 mins on the time allocated to the table as per booking conditions). We decided that we didn't want to stay longer and left to have a dessert and coffee somewhere else.  Great food it's the basic of a restaurant, but if staff is not polite, well prepared and without the basic manners, there is no way that I will go back......

Out of the crowd and tourist crowd, quiet place, I recommend booking, we were on the evening of December 7 with Madrid overflowing with tourists, but here you have to get there by metro , small but very cozy place, you eat very well , high quality , friendly and fast staff . The service, the food, the paella, the cheese cake everything was perfect I recommend, it is a wonder.

Broad, tree-lined avenues with pretty streetlights frame the neighborhood of Barrio Salamanca. With beautiful condominium buildings that make up most blocks in this area, this part of town is refined and quiet. It is also host to a few of the city's large shopping avenues, including Calle Serrano and Calle Jose Ortega y Gasset. A walk down these streets will reveal upscale chains, small boutiques, and plenty of opportunities for shopping or checking out the stylish displays. The locals here are polished and fashionable, the atmosphere is leisurely, and the lush Retiro Park on the southern border is yet another opportunity to enjoy the outdoors. A stroll through Barrio Salamanca is all about admiring the beautiful architecture, window-shopping, and people-watching in this upper-crust corner of Madrid.

We were eating on a Saturday and we really liked it. We ordered three main ones: risotto de boletus, a pizza carbonara and vegetable cannelloni. Exceptional service from Diana Carolina. Her knowledge of the menu and wine list was impressive, and her recommendations were spot-on. She was attentive without being intrusive and made our dining experience outstanding. A well-deserved 10/10.
The food is very rich and professionally made. Very good and friendly service. Optimum price quality. We didn't know him and in two days we're back.

Expansive plazas, local and foreign crowds, street performers, colorful lights, window shopping, restaurant signs promising the best paella, ham, and churros con chocolate- this is downtown Madrid, a collection of plazas interconnected by a network of side streets. Some of these side streets are wide pedestrian shopping routes, and some are hidden, so it's possible to duck in and out of the bustle as desired. The iconic Puerta del Sol is the giant crossroads of the city and a must-see attraction at any time of the day. The nearby Plaza Mayor, completely enclosed by historic red buildings, is an ideal place to grab a bite to eat outside, amidst scores of tables and people out for a stroll. Plaza Isabel II (also known as Opera) is smaller and a good meeting spot, and the stately Plaza del Oriente is the front yard of the Royal Palace. Centro can be touristy (pickpockets are unfortuately not unheard-of here), crowded, and sometimes gimmicky, but it is also the place to experience classic Madrid.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: The restaurant should be called Galactic!! The exceptional seafood paella, the living room downstairs is very romantic. Great wine, good price. Highly recommended in the area of Cava Baja , Barrio La Latina Madrid.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: Great, we have eaten fabulous grilled octopus the veiras and that sea bass and for those who like Austrian holiday loin meat, dessert Great and the attention of the waiters very well, especially Macarena Great, their attention Great

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: There's not too much to write about: one of the best paellas ever eaten! We are passing through Madrid and near our accommodation we found this restaurant, a wonderful discovery, we waited for the paella with ham and bread very good... Highly recommended

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: We chose to eat lobster rice and a helping of chistorra to start with. It was good, the food was good, the service was good, reasonable price

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: Unfortunately, my experience at this restaurant was disappointing. While the food itself was acceptable, the service was poorly organized.  Our dishes arrived separately, and the timing made no sensemy main course was served before the starter, which arrived much later. This completely disrupted the meal and took away from the dining experience.  Dining out should feel relaxed and enjoyable, not confusing and rushed. For the prices charged, I expected much better coordination from the kitchen and service staff.  Sadly, I wouldnt recommend this place based on this experience.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: We stayed here for dinner by reservation, really nice restaurant and in a nice and quiet area.  We had a really good and plentiful mixed paella, although the pieces of meat had lost a bit of flavor apart from that nothing to say, the price was right. Croquettes (given the long wait for paella that we had been warned about) and really good vegetables but with an exaggerated price, 16  for 4 croquettes is excessive, they cost twice as much as the average of restaurants of their same level, the same goes for grilled vegetables that cost 16 . The staff was really friendly and helpful and also the service is very well taken care of, it deserves 5 out of 5 but for fairness I put 4 for the quality / price ratio that should be improved on certain courses, since competitors are there and have much fairer prices on certain dishes, the exception is the paella which had a more than reasonable price.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: We ordered the paella, but did not realize you have to order for 2 person. The waiter did not say anything to us, but instead tried to upsell more food. When we realized the paella was for 2 person, a couple minutes later, we tried to change the order, but the waiter would not let us change the order. The paella came and it was terrible.. the taste was blah and the seafood was stale and not fresh. The octopus was good though.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: We found this restaurant through TripAdvisor. The restaurant's standards were not met at all. Upon entering, the music was very loud, and the staff did not appear very cheerful. The service was provided by only young individuals, and while there is no issue with that, it seemed there was no experienced figure to organize the service. In my opinion, the food was very average. I definitely would not recommend this place to anyone. Even the interior decoration appeared poorly maintained. I suggest considering other options as you can find much better in Madrid. This establishment is completely overrated.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: The place isn't worth its money, paelle regular, the price is on the menu for 1, but you can't order a portion like that, for at least two. 55 is expensive for a dish like this. No sangria, don't order unless you want to be disappointed. They barely understand English. Anyway, no more than yes.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: Delicious paella. And sweet, attentive service from a lady (Yadira). It is located in a cozy neighborhood, just outside the worst crowds. Beautiful decor vh restaurant - white linen and warm colors vh interior.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: Very nice place in the Latina district, excellent food and above all very good paella. They have about fifteen different types, we chose the seafood one, tasty and abundant, one of the best ever tasted. The potato tortilla is also good, perhaps a little too drooling for our taste. Fair wine list, good prices. We spent about 55 per person, correct price.

Restoran: La Taberna De Pealver Cava Baja
Recenzija: Nice place. Fast service. The only drawback they push to make you take more courses and not just paella saying it takes a long time.  We had a tortilla that was good but in the end it overfilled us and we left a bit of both.  If you are not a big eater I recommend ordering only paella.

Awful experience, Voluntary but ruthless Service, and an unacceptable dish that did not respond at all to what I had ordered and that smelled frighteningly rotten, as the waiters themselves recognized and that you asked to remove before returning at the same table for the stench it gave off. We went to enjoy brunch and the experience far exceeded our expectations. From the start, the treatment was impeccable, with attentive and professional Service in a serene and elegantly designed environment. The musical accompaniment, with piano and opera duet, was simply masterful.  It is clear that, after the recent renovation, the hotel is committed to excellence and works hard to achieve the level of the best luxury establishments in the city.  Special mention is made of Pedro Fonseca, head of the Food and Beverage department, for his impeccable management, and Gustavo Garca, the hotels sommelier, for his kindness and deep knowledge. An outstanding experience that we will certainly repeat.

This appears to be a lovely and an attractive dining option if you are a local. Although we ordered a full meal with an expensive bottle of wine, we waited endlessly for service and continued to have to ask for wine pours and additional needs. All the while, the servers provided excellent service enjoyed lengthy conversations with the obviously local residents. We understand that they realize we are unlikely to return, but this is not treatment you expect for an upscale restaurant. The food is above average but not exceptional. Sides and salad were good. Fish was undercooked, with one portion being nearly raw. Sorry to give a poor review for any restaurant in a city we love. We may go back for drinks in the lovely bar someday, but not to dine.

Good afternoon..actually if we ate at their restaurant but the staff did not check if we had or not reservation..it was a bittersweet experience because I made the reservation with a lot of enthusiasm and high expectations and it was an absolute disappointment..the staff was polite but they absolutely passed us..we had to call them for everything and considering the prices they have I think the attention should be more careful. We thought that in a restaurant of this category at least they should put a tablecloth .. it did not look like a restaurant but a cafeteria .. I thought that was not the case but I saw that I was wrong although the price of the drink is of michelin star. Disappointing, absolutely disappointing. Waiters waste your time waiting until they attend to you without knowing that "time is gold", especially in a place like this. I do not recommend it, unless you want to waste the afternoon.

We stayed a week at this hotel and ate here everyday for breakfast. The restaurant itself is gorgeous! The stained glass ceiling is amazing. The service was excellent. The food, each day, was great! A wide range of items on the buffet.

Eating in the hotel rotunda, under that wonderful glass dome, is a pleasure that can be found in few places. The food was splendid, highlighting some wonderful Iberian ham croquettes and some very delicious candied artichokes. For the main course I would highlight some really good grilled scallops with venere rice. For dessert, the cheesecake was good but nothing to write home about. The unbeatable service, very attentive and friendly.

Expansive plazas, local and foreign crowds, street performers, colorful lights, window shopping, restaurant signs promising the best paella, ham, and churros con chocolate- this is downtown Madrid, a collection of plazas interconnected by a network of side streets. Some of these side streets are wide pedestrian shopping routes, and some are hidden, so it's possible to duck in and out of the bustle as desired. The iconic Puerta del Sol is the giant crossroads of the city and a must-see attraction at any time of the day. The nearby Plaza Mayor, completely enclosed by historic red buildings, is an ideal place to grab a bite to eat outside, amidst scores of tables and people out for a stroll. Plaza Isabel II (also known as Opera) is smaller and a good meeting spot, and the stately Plaza del Oriente is the front yard of the Royal Palace. Centro can be touristy (pickpockets are unfortuately not unheard-of here), crowded, and sometimes gimmicky, but it is also the place to experience classic Madrid.

No obstante, debido al espacio del que disponemos en el restaurante, la ampliacin de la bodega es algo que en parte se nos escapa de las manos. Thank you very much for your review and for your kind words about both the food and dinner; we are truly delighted to know that your experience was so positive. Regarding our wine list, we appreciate your feedback. We currently work with wines made from 14 different grape varieties, all carefully selected. However, due to the limited space available in our restaurant, expanding the wine cellar is something that is partly beyond our control. Even so, we continue to strive to offer quality options and provide good advice. We hope to welcome you back very soon.

Entre Santos is not just a restaurant  its a love letter to gastronomy.

Every time we visit Madrid, its the one place we cannot resist. The food is nothing short of extraordinary  not a single dish is ever ordinary or predictable. Each plate carries a story, a twist, a spark of creativity, and is built from ingredients that are clearly of the highest quality.  The dedication and passion of the kitchen can be tasted in every bite, and the warmth of the staff is felt the moment you walk through the door. They are not only professional but genuinely lovely, making every guest feel special and at home.  And then, the cocktails  perfection in a glass, crafted with the same care and imagination as the dishes.  In our eyes, Entre Santos is the embodiment of what dining should be: creativity without pretension, excellence without compromise, and hospitality that comes from the heart. It is a rare gem that, without question, deserves a Michelin star. Until that day comes, it will remain our star in Madrid.

Went in with high expectations and left just a little disappointed. On the whole, good, interesting food but not great food. Example: the shrimp ceviche, which Ive eaten all over the world. Interesting presentation, but the shrimp just tasted off. The beef tenderloin bites proved tasty, but were overwhelmed by the potato chip flavor of the frites. The Chicken Mohammed, on the other hand, was interesting, innovative, and delicious. Same with the Entre Santos mocktail. Fun, but often distracted servers made for a bit disjointed meal.
Service was amazing!!! I love all the waiters they made this experience amazing! Ask for Charlie and Kevin. Food amazing, drinks amazing, love it all.

Great food, but the waiters beautiful and very nice. I would come back for sure!!!!!! Alejandro, a sweetheart.

LOVED everything about this place!! The staff was so much fun and welcoming. The drinks were cheap &amazing and the food was to die for!! My favorite was the ceviche and chimichurri steak (not picture) but would order the croquetas again.

Expansive plazas, local and foreign crowds, street performers, colorful lights, window shopping, restaurant signs promising the best paella, ham, and churros con chocolate- this is downtown Madrid, a collection of plazas interconnected by a network of side streets. Some of these side streets are wide pedestrian shopping routes, and some are hidden, so it's possible to duck in and out of the bustle as desired. The iconic Puerta del Sol is the giant crossroads of the city and a must-see attraction at any time of the day. The nearby Plaza Mayor, completely enclosed by historic red buildings, is an ideal place to grab a bite to eat outside, amidst scores of tables and people out for a stroll. Plaza Isabel II (also known as Opera) is smaller and a good meeting spot, and the stately Plaza del Oriente is the front yard of the Royal Palace. Centro can be touristy (pickpockets are unfortuately not unheard-of here), crowded, and sometimes gimmicky, but it is also the place to experience classic Madrid.

Bonjour, Est ce que c'est possible de ne pas d'avoir d'huile sur la viande, ou le.poisson et sur les lgumes?
i whas looking through the menu on the website and can see the prices... but are these prices per 100 grams ? id really love to know about the prices...

Although really expensive the experience was amazing. For the meat lovers to have the opportunity to taste amazing cuts and compare them paired with a good wine in Japanese style is unique. Service was also really good.

For our last night in Berlin we looked for something different for our evening meal. This restaurant wont let you down (if you like meat)  Great setting and atmosphere from the restaurant. Staff explained the process well and the food was delicious. Well worth a trip.  No alcohol free beers though

I celebrated my birthday there, with family and friends. It was very pleasant, the service super friendly, was always at the table, we could order constantly something without waiting long. We were told the cleanliness, the meat, the grill, what to consider. The staff were competent and knew what they were doing. On them I saw that the whole team, boss, kitchen work well together and a harmonious atmosphere prevails. The meat was a feast for the eyes, served so beautifully and trained on the tellen. The taste, heavenly. I'm rather pretty, but this beef, which can also grill without spices, top quality and there too even yourself. That's as good as it gets. In total, we were supposed to be 11 people, in the end we were 5, normal white ones stay aif the costs, of course we would still have fried the meat and taken it with us, but the chef could use it differently, so I did not have to pay the rest, also there for thanks. Thanks to the whole team, it was a wonderful evening, we are still struggling today from :D it was something very special.

A big thank you for this great discovery! We absolutely loved our experience. We chose a set menu, which was more than enough in terms of quantity. We received all the necessary explanations on how to use the grill properly. Special thanks to the kind waitress who took the time to give us helpful tips for our upcoming trip to Japan. A delicious and enriching experience!

It was good. Cannot complain on the service or the quality of the food. The wagyu and black angus were truly fresh and juicy. The ambiance was clean, chic and serene.   It is suitable for groups. But also, for couples. One thing to know is - they don't serve coffee. That's all.  So all in all, good place.
The food was great and the staff was fantastic!  My girlfriend loved the blue lychee drink, and we had to buy some extra of the dipping sauce to bring home because it was simply that good.

Appears like an authentic Japanese BBQ. The room and the seats are somewhat sterile and therefore do not become a place you might sit longer than you have to.  Good selection of meat. We chose mixed menu for 53  per person, then you get with rice and a very small portion of vegetables on sharing. The meat was fantastic, but there was too little food in general and at that price. Accessories of sides cost 6  and are also small portions. Good food experience, but price and total experience make us probably not coming back.

amazing in every aspect: food, service, interior. excellent. recommend to everyone. Had a delightful dinner with my family at this place. We tried wagyu, seafood and most of the american meat as well as pork belly and different salads. Every single thing was absolutely delicious. And I think this sums up this restaurant pretty well.

We ate well even though we did not have high expectations. The place is not particularly welcoming. The Owner is in the kitchen and takes the utmost care in preparing the dishes. All good and freshly cooked.

The place is black! Ceiling, walls, floor - I don't like it at all - like in a tomb. The meat is grilled at the table, which makes it very hot. Prices are excessive !!! A kilo of Waguy is charged about 900, which is a bad joke. The meat is quite tender because it is marbled with fat. We paid 300 for two, which was 150 too much. Cardy rice costs 4,50 extra, each dip or vegetable is charged separately, a glass of Primitivo 0,2 l hits with 14. For me, the place is incomprehensible and not a place to draw me again !

Overpriced for the quality. Side dishes poorly prepared and inadequate. For three people, a total of 3 mushrooms, 3 slices of zucchini and 3 small pieces of pumpkin. Insufficient amount of sauces. We cannot recommend a visit.
An experience you absolutely must try if you are a meat lover. Very helpful and friendly staff. High prices but proportionate to the food you are tasting.

We were told everything on the menu, how to grill the food, the accompanying dips, and the homemade soy sauce was very tasty. It was a relaxed evening. A little more expensive, but we're happy to pay more for the good quality.

Worst service ever starting from the booking on the website where it at the end of the acceptance of my request mail states a standard talk/talk about they will get back to the customer in 48h.. where other restaurants have their booking online, Ushido may benefit from moving into the 21st century on this point.  I hadnt head any thing I was surprised to get mail only 6 hours this round birthday dinner telling me that there was no seat tonight, as I was getting ready for the evening.  When I called the restaurant to try to get confirmation or see if I could have a different time I spoke with an English speaking man heavy German accent who said quote begin I cannot and I will not help you continuing in a most sarcastic tone have a nice birthday quote end he cut ten connection immediately after making the sarcastic remark.  So I cant comment on the food but only hope service in the restaurant is more professional.  No I wont bother to book this restaurant again BERLIN is full of nice restaurants with the service in top.

go there hungry otherwise you will not cope with the amount of food you will served

This restaurant is incredible; the vibe, the service and the food of course, see other reviews for the food reviews as I'd just repeat them. I'm not at all adventurous in my food choices and so this really stressed my brain/pallet but all for no reason. 10/10; incredible

Went here in a group of 7 and it was great. Very helpful staff suggesting how many dishes to order and friendly throughout. Food and venue were great and drinks good.  We booked and suggest you do too if you want to guarantee table

Visited this restaurant on our first night in Berlin. We made a reservation as the reviews were great and we didnt want to miss out by not getting a table! We werent disappointed. The concept of German food served tapas style was brilliant and the food was amazing. Our server was Jonas: he was really helpful and his recommendations for both the food and wine were spot on. Hes a real credit to the restaurant and really made our evening. Would definitely recommend a meal here.
An outstanding evening. The software phenomenal and service was superb. I would hire recommend to anyone who wants to have German cuisine in a different style on their trip to Berlin
Friendly and helpful from the start. The German tapas offering was varied, interesting and flavoursome. Great wine too. Helpful, personal and friendly service.

An atmospheric German restaurant near Alexanderplatz.Decor superb.Staff extremely attentive and take a long time going through the menu with us.Traditional German food served tapas style.As an example choose say cheese filled dumpling with slow cooked beef.Then do the same with other choices.Great experience,lovely staff great atmosphere and not expensive.hard was staggering back to underground one stop from Alexanderplatz.

We've come on our honeymoon to Berlin and wanted to have a really nice dining experience whilst out, dressed up and wanting to try something unique- after researching we decided on PeterPaul, for the really interesting menu and fine dining small plates concept on traditional German cuisine. We didn't quite know what to expect but wanted something different. I'm so glad we decided on this place- the staff were absolutely brilliant, so attentive, personable and you can tell they really have a passion for what they do and take great pride in what they have going at the restaurant. The venue itself was very cool- in an effortless, inner city style, gave an exclusive and sexy feel but not in a pretentious way. We were recommended a few dishes as we wanted to try as many different flavour profiles and we weren't pushed to have too many- just recommended the perfect amount. Absolutely divine food. So many interesting flavours, textures and combinations. We also enjoyed a really nice bottle of Reisling - great wine menu for those who enjoy a glass. Thanks for making our evening so enjoyable PeterPaul team! Will recommend to any friends next coming to Berlin. X
Nice restaurant Good food! We ate currywurst, sild, Roastbiff and chicken. German food in Tapas format Very goodRecommended at the hottest

This is an absolute Hidden Gem in Berlin- 2nd Visit and it was even better The Ambience, Buzz, Decor and Staff are all superb The food is simply sensational Nice Wines Clemens the Maitre D' was very attentive and really made our visit special Excellent Value for money- especially if you live in Dublin!

Have a nice evening during a long weekend in Berlin. Absolutely recommended. Delicious dishes, fine portions and beautiful matching wines. More than excellent value for money. Funny that the co-pilot of the restaurant turned out to speak Dutch.
I can only agree with the positive reviews before me: very nice, attentive Service and very delicious food!

Absolutely not to be missed, if you come to Berlin you absolutely must try this place, it is the best we have eaten in! Dishes are carefully curated with balanced flavors, I absolutely recommend the cheesy dumings, potato salad and Berlin-style meatballs, all really delicious. We also had a bottle of local Pinot Noir. The staff is really genital, helpful and courteous. We spent about  50 per person with a total of about 8/9 dishes and a bottle of wine, the price is absolutely worth it and reflects the quality of the restaurant, three dishes we took twice from how delicious they were! The cuisine is traditional German but reinterpreted in a modern key, the portions are a middle ground between tapas and normal dish, so you can taste and share with friends or family more dishes and try new tastes! Really highly recommended, go there!!!
Nice place, friendly staff but too expensive for what you get.  11 for a curry sausage  or  18 for 2 pieces of meat

Overall, the experience was fairly good. The service was friendly, and the atmosphere was pleasant. However, there were a few aspects that could be improved  some details felt a bit overlooked, and the quality didnt fully meet expectations. Still, it was enjoyable enough, and with a few adjustments, it could easily be great. Worth a try!

Classic German food served elegantly as a sharing menu. The food is tasty, with small interpretations and still true to the German origin.  The fifth star is for truly carried out and attentive service, with great love for the food, the wine, the place and the guest. Here I will come back the next time I visit Berlin.
