Vielen Dank fr ihr Feedback, wir haben uns ihrer Kretik angenommen und besprochen. Schne Gre aus dem Rutz und vllt. bis bald! Ihr Rutz Team

Mein Lieber Herr Rolf A. M., wir bedanken uns fr eine so konstruktive Kritik und nehmen mal von einigen ihner genannten Punkte Abstand. Was wir nicht hinnehmen ist ihr Ansatz, denn wenn sie sich genauso gut auf dieses Event vorbereitet htten wie wir, htten sie gewusst dass das Rutz 2 Gastronomien unter einem Dach betreibt, zur einen eine Weinbar & zu anderen das darber liegende 2 Sterne Restaurant, also gut brgerlich & Avantgarde. Dann htten sie auch gewusst dass das Rutz mit seiner kleinen Bodenstndigen Weinbar unterwegs war und nicht mit seinem Restaurant und damit auch zu keiner Zeit der Anspruch bestand der 2 Sternekche gerecht zu werden. Seine Bodenstndige aber uerst produktsichere Kche passte fr uns sehr gut zu diesem Weingut. Aber sicherlich haben sie das in der Bewerbung der Veranstaltung grozgig berlesen. Was sie aber richtig verstanden haben ist, das wir das besondere im Produkt suchen, das Huhn von einem Zchter aus unserer Region stammt und dieses von so auer gewhnlich guter Qualitt ist, das man damit keinen Schnick Schnack betreiben muss. Des Weiteren sollten sie verstehen, dass wir unsere Fische, unser Fleisch fast ausschlielich bei 60C garen und servieren, was ein wirkliches hei und sehr warm generell ausschliet, aber ein saftiges, butterzartes und glasiges Stck hervor bringt, die Produkte nicht trocken auslaufen und damit zh macht, sondern den Eigenegeschmack bewahrt. Wir knnen uns auch sehr gut an ihren Tisch erinnern, da es von 400 servierten Mens nur eine derartige Reklamation gab. Was den halbgefrorene Cheese Cake angeht liegen sie leider falsch, was sie beschreiben war in der Tat ein Halbgefrorenes, aber kein Cheese Cake sondern ein Parfait von der Lrche, was schon sehr auergewhnlich ist, finden sie nicht auch. Der Cheese Cake an sich war eine Interpretation als Creme aufgespritzt & Amarettini Brseln, kam brigens sehr gut an. Also das Ganze hat also nichts mit Landeiern oder arroganten Berlinern zu tun, sondern schlicht weg mit Uninformiertheit ihrer Seits und mir scheint sie mgen unsere Art der Weinbarkche nicht und ok, man merkt auch einwenig ihre Unkenntnis in hheren Geschmacksfragen... was auch aus unserer Sicht vollkommen legitim ist. Vllt. kommen sie uns doch einmal in unserem Restaurant besuchen, wann sie interessiert was Herr Mller und sein Team zubereiten. Mit freundlichen Gren, ihr Rutz Team

Certainly the best michelin restaurant out of the 5 we tried this week in Berlin, deserve all 3 stars  The set menu is long with 13 courses and it took 4 hours. Every course is very good to excellent, not easy. Unlike many other michelin restaurants , the staff are friendly and knowledgeable
One of the best Michelin-starred restaurant experiences Ive ever had. The appetizers, main courses and wine pairing was simply exquisite !
Skip this "so called" 3-star restaurant and to spend your money somewhere else

This restaurant is probably the worst Michelin "starred" one and we have been to many of them. To start, the food was mediocre and once the fish dishes were done, they served a beet root as a transition to other dish. This root dish was so salty that cannot be eaten. Server knew and didn't do anything or say anything. Then following all the dishes, another 3 were so salty that they were left untouched. The gelatin on top of the chicken liver was the worst in term of saltiness. When the server came to collect the dish, she looked at it and "said I know.." I asked to hold salt on the beef, but just about barely edible. I am not sure how such food quality can receive 3-star rating.  I might be personal, but a dinner after over US1,000, this shouldn't be the case. Also, I was very reluctant to tip after dinner, but the server stood next to you and kept reminding the guests that tips was extra. Goodness! I was forced to tip, what a terrible experience.
Horny 3 star treat stamp in our capital Berlin and has been for 24 years

Moin Folks,  Moin Folks,  a few years ago I was already here and now with my best friends and it was trumpet galactically awesome here  The welcome was already very attentive and accommodating, then up to the first floor and there the same table as then, Hammergeil The big course menu has kept what it promised via menu In this year, the pleasure was the highlight so far, thank you. Next year will certainly be even better, then 25 years Restaurant Rutz, I can only recommend it with my friends
One of the top meals we have ever had- the food was exceptional and the presentation exquisite. Staff all extraordinary
Epic dinner in Berlin  One of the top meals we have ever had- the food was exceptional and the presentation exquisite. Staff all extraordinary

I've been wanting to go there for a long time, now we've been there. The fact that there is a shortened menu recently, we find great and were immediately "in." However, our expectations - and also many experiences - of a 3-star restaurant were not met: Wrongly printed menu, wine - we had the drink accompaniment - which absolutely did not taste us to the course - a really outstanding beetroot dish. We were "jilted" in front of full glasses, which were then fully cleared even without any demand. At the next table - wine accompaniment - a chardonnay was served with the dish, which we could have imagined - and if there had been an extra charge, this would also have gladly paid. But: We were not asked and unfortunately there was no service team around us at the time that we could have asked for it. As a digestif, we were handed another actually sparkling drink - we can't remember exactly what it was - but that unfortunately lay completely lifeless in the glass.  But there was someone from the Service nearby, the drink was immediately exchanged without much demand - was also obvious. The food itself: good, but not extraordinary or something that sticks in the memory. Neither of the preparation nor of the ingredient or taste. A nice evening. Now we were there once. But: We won't be back, but it wasn't impressive - we expect that with 3 stars - enough and there are also so many other restaurants to discover.

The expectations of the 3-star restaurant were more than met for us. Cool location, pleasantly spacious tables with space and spacing, uncomplicated Service - and on the plate one taste explosion after another, all light and fresh without butter or heaviness. Super wine list with surprisingly moderate pricing. For us after the Cheval Blanc / Basel the greatest 3-star hotel. Prima! Thank you.
The food was excellent, especially the fish dishes were awesome. The non-alcoholic beverage accompaniment was very innovative and good.

Not worthy of a three-macaroon restaurant. Plate level one macaron and service / room level two macarons (and again)  If I take the imposed evening menu: Re-hydrated tomato & redwood tree - uninteresting tomato but remarkable broth Oyster & green strawberry - very good Baked fish & Dill - very nice MAGNOLIA & YELLOWTAIL MACKEREL, rhubarb - I didn't like it at all BEETROOT & HORSERADISH, sumac - bon LEEKS, ONIONS & POTATO, pepperweed - bon GARDEN PEAS & ASPARAGUS, chicken skin - I didn't particularly like it WILD GARLIC, BUNTES BENTHEIMER & Koji - I didn't particularly like it WAGYU & GARUM, Kohlrabi - exceptional, only dish really up to dinner DRY AGED LAMB & BUN, BEANS - not bad Truffle & buckwheat - cool and nice FENNEL & VERBENA, clementine - I didn't like it at all Knotweed & pink - I didn't like it at all  No cuteness: this is not allowed in a three Michelin macarons (especially after technical desserts more than gourmet)

We visited Rutz in Berlin (3 Michelin stars) during the Easter weekend 2025. The reception and service were good, the atmosphere okay, although the overall look felt somewhat businesslike and distant.  As for the food: disappointing for a three-star establishment. The balance of flavours was often not right  several dishes were far too salty, while others were far too acidic. In terms of structure and presentation, there was no excitement or innovation. Each dish consisted of one element with a sauce served separately. Compared to other star-studded stores we visited earlier, this was clearly lagging behind.  The price is exceptionally high. We knew this beforehand, but it is precisely because of this that the bar is also considerably higher. At this price range you expect special ingredients or pronounced techniques, but they were largely lacking.  In a city like Berlin, there are plenty of alternatives where you will be surprised more culinary for less money.

Money may govern many things, but it buys neither style nor decency. A 3-star restaurant stands for the highest culinary art, first-class service and a special atmosphere. Anyone who goes there should have respect not only for the food but also for the work of the cooks and staff.  Short trousers and bathing slippers destroy this very atmosphere. Fine dining is not only a matter of taste, but also of experience. Anyone who shows up in sweatpants or beach outfit shows that they dont care about this experience  and thats disrespectful to all other guests who have deliberately chosen this ambience.  Style and decency do not mean you have to dine in a suit, but a certain level of care should be taken for granted. Money alone doesnt make a gentleman  it shows in attitude, respect and behaviour. Mr Mller doesnt care, everyone is welcome , there could be a potential CIO or higher behind every casual outfit. Money rules the world!

The disappointment began with the entree, with the music. Annoyingly South American, irritatingly close to the threshold of hearing. Mood killer. The ambience careless and very boring. Bald and matter-of-fact can be good, see Cookies Cream, but at Rutz it looks more like a canteen. You'd need a good interior designer. The fuller the store, the louder it got, which sometimes made a conversation exhausting. We like star restaurants with more distance to the neighboring tables, because space also means luxury. Clearly listening to the conversations of the businessmen next door is not.  We had chosen the 8-course veggie menu, without wine accompaniment, which already raised eyebrows. Greetings from the kitchen were exciting and promised excellent. Then, however, things continued rather less spectacularly. The kitchen is undoubtedly creative. Something is on offer to the eye, kitchen with tweezers. But we missed the special, extraordinary taste. We found the truffle upgrade of an aisle particularly annoying. A dish with a few slices of black winter truffles that had little of their own taste  for an extra 49 euros.  The Plum & Kernl dessert was one of the highlights, as was the final greeting from the Autumn Prince & Green Juniper kitchen. The service was attentive from the beginning and quite professional. We wanted two particularly interesting glasses of wine from the sommelier. One was indeed, the other somehow arbitrary. On our way home, we discussed whether we were simply too untrained in rating a 3-star kitchen (Das Rutz was only our 2. Experience), but in the end it matters whether you come out of a restaurant enthusiastically. The 2-star restaurant of the week before had set a benchmark for us that the Rutz clearly did not reach (anymore?). Our bill amounted to 890  excluding tips.

The best we've ever experienced. Sustainable cuisine, local ingredients, taste variations never heard before, let alone tasted, embedded in perfect service around host Falco mills and perfectly coordinated wine recommendations.

I was bringing my mom to celebrate her retirement - her first three Michelin Star restaurant experience. The food is spectacular. The taste and dish presentation were on the nose. The problems I faced were with the service - things I have never experienced in other top-tier, three star restaurants. Some of these are inexcusable errors. I left highly disappointed.  First, we were told by our server that we get a taste before the pour so we thought this applied to all of our drinks rather than only the wines. When we were given our first non-alcoholic pairing, there was no instruction that this is the actual pair and not a taste, also the dish came about 10-15 minutes later so we drank it. The server who brought over the dish was confused because she did not see the pairing at our table and had to ask us whether we had already tried the catfish. We told her that we thought it was a tasting to see if we liked the drink so she had graciously gone to ask the somm whether we can have a refill with our dish. The somm had instructed our server that we could get a refill only if we wanted to pay extra. Granted it tasted great, the cost of making the vegetable juice is insignificant compared to wine.  Second, when we wanted to use the restroom, we were asked to wait until after the main course as it was coming soon. The service should be working around the guest, not the other way around.  Third, I noticed that I received the WRONG bill - it was more than what I am supposed to pay.  I've given this exact feedback to the restaurant when they emailed me for it. It's been over a week and have yet to receive any responses. This is yet another example of how service is lacking.

The visit to the Rutz (***) was absolutely extraordinary in every respect. Extraordinarily exciting because I have probably never eaten in such a high-class restaurant that has such a strong philosophy and lives. Exceptionally delicious, because nevertheless each dish simply tastes extremely good and often provides memories of tastes from childhood, for example. And exceptionally sympathetic, because you feel right in good hands in this beautiful restaurant, with chef Marco Mller, who presented and explained a course directly at the kitchen, and with the service team around restaurant manager Falco. Thank you for this fantastic evening!

Great food and friendly people. I really enjoyed the jollof rice with plantain and fried beef. I've tried it twice now and I never regret it
Order one of the homemade drinks. They're actually really good and exotic
Hallo. Wie grosse Gruppen koennen bei Ihnen auf einmal im Innenbereich bewirtet werden ?
Great food for a reasonable price. The portions could be a bit bigger. Friendly service and nice atmosphere! Can definetely recommend this place!

Actually, we came across the restaurant by chance because we stay nearby and we love the West African food. So we made reservations by phone.  But what we experienced there surprised us.  Bantabaa is incredibly authentic with the selection of food and drinks but the quality is at the highest level.  If you still have such a courteous service and even the chef stops by... we only know that from other price ranges.  The Bantabaa is really an insider tip and we will come back! Thank you for the great evening at your place.
The food is very delicious, balanced and varied! Just great! I can recommend the mixed plate for 2 people and the banana bread:)
Welcome variety in Berlin's restaurant landscape, delicious and varied dishes, great drinks, friendly staff,
Very good, authentic food, very friendly atmosphere - I look forward to eating there again and recommend the restaurant very much!
Excellent culinary journey to West Africa. Wonderful puff puff and Benachin with chicken. Hot sauce is indeed that. Charming place with outside seating.
We had the mixed plate of different dishes and the pasta bag as a starter, which by the way was a 10 out of 10! Also very friendly and polite staff, only to recommend. 5 of 5

I had never had Gambian food before, and wow have I been missing out! My husband and I split the tour platter, which was a little bit of everything. It was absolutely delicious. We added chicken for more protein. What a terrific way to experience Berlins cultural and culinary diversity. Highly recommend!!

Superb. We went for the sharing platter with mackerel and cant fault any of it. So tasty, such a great combination of flavours. And the little bowl of hot sauce was one of the best Ive ever had. When we come back to Berlin, we will be coming back here for sure.
Very good experience where you can taste delicious gambian food and drinks. Definitely a must if you are in Berlin. Fast service and moderate price.
Super super delicious!!! I love this kitchen  it tastes great and the atmosphere is really nice too!!!!
First time trying Gambian food. It was delicious. I will definitely come back to try all the other dishes. Highly recommended
The food is amazing, first time trying Gambian dishes and this is so delicious. Will definitely come back again !! Highly recommended !
The food very tasty well seasoned and served quickly. The tea - cold or hot - especially recommended. Very nice are the starters. Something completely different.

Hallo, ich wrde gern wissen, ob ihr die flambierte Pasta mit Trffel im Parmesanlaib am Tisch zubereitet. Wrde das gern mal probieren. Danke an euch!!!
Schade, solche Kommentare zu lesen die absolut unntig sind und keinen etwas bringen. Konstruktive Kritik ist immer gut, aber hier lsst einfach nur jemand seinen Frust raus! Schade

hi! i would like to make a reservation on 26.08. but can we make a birthday reservation? what can you offer? i would like to see if theres also a menu or choice related to it such as a little celebration or cake will also be amazing. thankyou

Excellent food!!! Poor service! Venue good.. food was beautiful. Service poor overall. From start to finish- waiting staff made no EFFORT to go above and beyond. E.g. no warm welcome, slow service overall, no offer of wine menu (had to ask), no offer of sauce with steak, dessert, coffee, more drinks etc. Gave us bread, olives, water (although 8.50) Lovely place, food was amazing!! The chef was the best thing there.
The food is good, the wines are great and the staff is excellent, very professional and very friendly. They really know how to make a party!

A solid higher end restaurant. Design is great, very well thought out. Service was also solid. The food was otherwise great, but the scallop pizza tasted like nothing, the scallops need some seasoning.
Excellent cuisine  Excellent Service / generous!  Excellent wines  Go on! This is already our second visit and we will return
Am often here the Mood is unbeatable. The food is very nicely arranged and tastes very good at a fair price.

I dined on the terrace on a coated table, overlooking a beautiful bouquet of proteas. The welcome is very smiling and I was offered a very nice table when I arrived an hour and a half before my booking time. I enjoyed a dish of bluefin tuna snacked on a bed of avocado, accompanied by a truffle puree and small seasonal vegetables. A delight! I had a glass of Primitivo, which I found particularly good (subtle, not too powerful). Addition of 50 EUR. A beautiful experience, to renew as a couple!
It was a great evening! Very good food, thoughtful staff and a great atmosphere. Would definitely come back! Highly recommended.
Perfect place, we come there directly from Albania , everything was perfect, food , service! Absolutely recomandet!  10/10

A fantastic evening with my family. A superb restaurant. The food was top notch. The waiter chose a red wine that was unbeatable.  We had oysters, pasta dishes and pizza with truffle. A very attentive staff made the visit extra good. Will definitely come back next time we visit Berlin.

The food is TOP, a nice ambience! I highly recommend it.  Service:  - The gentlemen were nice, did a really good job.  - The only woman working in the service is arrogant and unprofessional. Pretends she's nice and friendly, but when she doesn't like it, she acts like a little girl. It's gonna be pretty uncomfortable and bitchy. The restaurant is of a high standard and the staff, in my opinion, must be of the same standard. Unfortunately, this nice woman does not match the level.

I attended a birthday celebration at Mjalt Presents and had a great time. The food was genuinely good and very enjoyable, with everyone at the table happy with what was served. It was a warm and pleasant experience, and I would happily return again.
Waited 30 min to be seated. Food and service was terrible. We left before the dessert but was offered no payment.  Never never never again.

Ristorante Mjalt offers a wonderful dining experience with delicious, well-prepared dishes and great presentation. This place consistently delivers excellence. Authentic Italian recipes with modern technique, attentive staff, fresh ingredients, and a classy yet relaxed atmosphere make it worth every visit.
Amazing service and truly authentic Italian taste! The staffs warmth and the inviting atmosphere make every visit memorable. The pasta dishes are especially outstanding.
The restaurant is very popular, so there was a wait  but the excellent service, perfectly cooked pasta, and beautiful setting made it worth it.

My visit to Ristorante Mjalt in Berlin was an absolute delight. From the warm ambiance to the fresh, well-crafted dishes, everything impressed. The octopus starter, porcini risotto, Barolo pairing, and tiramisu created a perfect dining experience.

What an extraordinary evening! The atmosphere was warm and sophisticated, service impeccable, and every dish beautifully prepared with rich, layered flavors. Fresh pasta and perfect wine pairings made the experience unforgettable.
A modern twist on authentic Italian flavors. The homemade pasta was delicious, the service warm and professional, and the setting perfect for a date night.
We had an amazing time; great food, fab wine, wonderful service. Highly recommend! Around the corner from the Kultur Brauerei so perfect for dinner followed by culture

This restaurant has become our go-to spot for celebrations. The quality and service are consistently outstanding, and the staff always make us feel remembered. The food is exceptional and beautifully served, with an elegant yet comfortable atmosphere.
Known for warm hospitality and genuinely Italian cuisine, this place has a cozy charm thats perfect for quiet, romantic dinners. A wonderful experience from start to finish.
An extraordinary experience at Mjalt  authentic cuisine and a warm atmosphere in Berlin Prenzlauer Berg

1A. Toller Service. Excellent food. Fully recommended. When I get back to Berlin, I will come back here.

Slow and disastrous Service Two entrecotes of scarce 250gr each at the modest figure of 96 practically 200 per kg hurray Salad of rocket and cherry tomatoes for two at the modest amount of 17 ca ... hurray You get up and you feel like you've been mugged...

We came on our first night in Berlin and it didnt disappoint! We were looking for really tasty food and got exactly that. Ordered 2 pulled pork burger and both were so tasty and priced so reasonably. Staff so friendly and very helpful. Will definitely be back!

If you order two 300gr file steaks, you expect two file steaks to be served. But if the steak leftovers are served and it is explained, in total that is 2x 300gr then it is fraud on the customer  By the way, the bill of course said filet steak

A really negative experience ! I received a voucher from my colleagues for   150,00 and this I could not redeem , because I did not have the checkout slip with me. ( A GIFT ! NO CHECKOUT NOTE ) We couldn't order with it.

We had an amazing experience at this restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious. The service was outstanding as well; the staff was attentive, friendly, and made sure everything was perfect. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, making the whole experience even more enjoyable. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and excellent service. Will definitely be coming back!

The restaurant concept seemed very special (like an event) and the prices were auspiciously high. Unfortunately, you felt like a guest in a train station restaurant. No real hospitality was felt. Order...food .. ready .. (all within an hour! All very hectic ! Too bad! Apparently, it should be sold quickly to be able to offer the table again. The dishes (grilled shrimp) and rump steak never had the stated weight, even if one assumes the gross weight. We had decided on the preparation in the kitchen. We could have roasted ourselves at the table. The rum steak was a thin piece of meat and came through instead of medium. According to the complaint, the meat was minimally thicker. Overall, the food was nothing special, but exorbitantly expensive! Overall, I would not recommend the restaurant.

We went for a birthday whilst on a city break in Berlin. I wanted to book a good steak restaurant and searched on Trip Adviser. The reviews seemed good.  We didnt realise it was a Turkish restaurant but that wasnt really a problem. Good, attentive staff. Quick, rather rushed service. The major problem was the pricing. I didnt see anywhere on the menu that the steaks are priced on weight. I ordered a 200g Argentinian fillet at 37. I was charged 60 when the bill came. Our bill for 2 adults and 2 teenagers came to 300. The food was average, the service was good but the price was ridiculous.

Amazing place, under the subway tracks, fantastic food very charming environment, almost exclusively frequented by Berliners. Absolutely recommended
Beautiful German gem, see for your German brown cafe with traditional food. Food arrived quickly but very tasty! Great portions and friendly staff. Assortment of beers also huge.

We wanted to eat inside but we weren't allowed to. Everyone had to eat in the beer garden across the road. Smoking is allowed at all tables there. It is next to the railway and a busy road. So you can't eat outside nice and quiet.  We didn't love the food. The salad was very bad. Dehydrated and brown edges on the lettuce. The pepper was very weak and you could bend it without it breaking. I would not recommend this restaurant.

We stopped here after a beer at the beer garden where it was too late for food. Im so glad we did. The food was fabulous, the portions huge and prices reasonable. They had great microbrew beers too. We may come come back to try the pork knuckles - they looked so meaty and the meat just fell from the bone. We had the spaetzle with bacon and the chicken cordon blue. Both great choices. I highly recommend!

Charming local, carved under the railway near the Tiergarden stop. Few places available, better to book. Typical German pub setting, with shared tables. Maybe a little noisy but it's part of the local type. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Traditional dishes are served in some cases slightly revisited (usually presented as proposals of the day). Excellent quality and monstrous quantities. We tried duck, cheese spatzel and boulette. Great choice of beers. Prices below the city average: 62 (tip excluded) for 3 large dishes (you ate at least four), 2 beers and water.

Great place  Excellent food at a good price Letter in Spanish  Live music  I ended up dancing on the track Very funny  If you don't want to wait too long for the food to be brought to you don't go to rush hour I would certainly repeat
Local beer and Schnitsell , very good, a traditional restaurant in Berlin for traditional German food

If you take the northern exit from the platform, you land right next to the entrance to the spring. The ambience is quaint, the staff friendly and prudent. The local beer and food are delicious. In addition to the menu, there are also changing dishes. The portions are sufficient for normal hunger. A timely reservation is recommended. We will definitely come back.
Really lovely cosy restaurant. We had the Berlin Meatballs and the Game Goulash. Both were really tasty. Beers and service were also great. Traditional music was played for a donation.

A restaurant that doesnt pay for a mine from outside but once you walk through the door. We discover a typical German tavern , very rustic , very warm welcome , simple cuisine but on homemade and gargantuan quantities a big thank you

Very authentic atmosphere. We were made to feel very welcome and the children were even given a lollipop at the end. The food tastes good and the portions are massive! Id definitely recommend pre-booking as it is very popular and difficult to find space in. Definitely worth the visit!

Cool pub/restaurant under the train tracks. Weather was not so great, so they were seating indoors. We were in the front room. The back room appeared to be a private party. Very crowded, communal tables. Popular with the locals. Lots of drink options, including extensive bottle beer options. Draft beer was from a local brewery, Lemke. This was fun because I have a friend named Lemke, took some coasters for him. I had the goulash with red cabbage and boiled potatoes. Wife had the meatballs with potato salad and a big pickle. Both were nice but my wife preferred to add my leftover sauce to her meatballs. The pickle was very good, especially with the meatball or with the potato salad. We finished with a brownie in vanilla sauce, served warm and quite tasty. Staff spoke English, and was helpful, despite the crowds. Service was reasonably quick. Menu had a nice selection, as well as a handful of specials. To drink I had a one of the standard Lemke beers, but I also tried a Berliner Weisse beer as well. This is Germanys answer to the Belgian Lambic. The beer is naturally sour, so they temper that by adding fruit syrup, like raspberry or cherry. Another options is a herbal mixture, Woodruff. Hard to describe the last one, to me it is kind of minty. All are sweet. The sweet addition rounds out the sourness. Probably not for everyone, but if you like sour beers, I suggest you try it sometime. . While it may be discovered it is first a neighborhood place. Love that about it.
Not a good meal  Unfortunately the schnitzel was terrible and the food took more than forever  Very disappointing  Also too expensive
Great food and service. It was very busy, we had to wait a while for a table to become available. Tasty food, not expensive and large portions. Highly recommended.

I can recommend this pub to all travelers to Berlin. The interior is old and worn out, which has a special charm. In addition, there is a very good menu with solid home cooking or bourgeois cuisine. From the Wiener Schnitzel to the Haxe you get everything you imagine under German cuisine. I always liked it and the portions are very large.

Very complete menu of dishes, servers of extreme sympathy, it was a really pleasant evening with six of our children. Everything we chose in dishes was really delicious. We recommend for the quality of meals, quantity also. Go ahead, you won't be disappointed!

We ordered drinks, starters, and main courses, and in under 5 minutes our mains appeared which suggests to me that the curries are not freshly prepared. While the food itself was average, we never received our starters & dips. When a server asked if we had enjoyed our meal, the missing starters still had not been addressed. We were charged for all the food and when I pointed out that we had not received items, the server looked confused instead of apologetic!! The service is disorganised and rushed, with too many tables crammed into the space. The experience felt more like buffet-style dining; eat quickly and move on, lacking attention to detail. Apart from the fact that there was nothing wrong with the choice of food and the quality and the spicy homemade bread gave an idea of the successful evening in front, it must be emphasized that the service and hospitality were absolutely exceptional. We have not experienced such attentive service and friendly and humorous service for a long time, apart from visits to the absolute top gastronomy, as we did during our visit to the Pantry. We had the feeling of being welcomed to friends. Too bad we don't live in Berlin. We would definitely be regulars here. Thanks again for the wonderful evening. nice place, super food, price quality very good. am fan who 2 gay garcon's:-) hilarious to see those busy. wide choice for who wants what

Addendanace at arrival was excellent and also service during the dinner. Starters with Chardonnay White wine were good. Not happy at all with the steak filet, which was the most expencive main disc, not tender and lots of fat. We could eat only half of the steak.

A great place to go food was great quality and also was cheap. I would recommend if you are a student.The flavors are also amazing.

am very satisfied eating tastes very delicious I can only recommend ittop eating with worker are very nice

Haveli is a true gem! The food was bursting with flavor  every dish tasted freshly prepared and perfectly seasoned. I tried the lamb curry and paneer tikka, and both were fantastic. The food was superb, one of the best Indian restaurants I've had in Berlin. The ambiance was inviting, creating a cozy and welcoming atmosphere that made for a soothing dining experience. The employees were true professionals, able to explain the dishes in detail while paying attention to small touches like asking if I needed anything else and checking in occasionally about the food and my experience. Finally, they offered me an excellent complimentary juice to cleanse my palate.

In 1963, Schneberg was the center of the political west, inspiring John F. Kennedy to choose this area to famously announce, "Ich bin ein Berliner." Times may have changed, but modern-day Schneberg still pays tribute to its historical legacies. Once the richest city outside of Berlin proper, the area's affluent past is still visible in ornate housing facades dating back to the Grnderzeit of the 19th century, while residents in fur coats walking their dogs or shopping in high-end KaDeWe continue the tradition with a modern flair. Schneberg was also once the center of the decadent and burlesque nightlife of the 1920s. It was here that Marlene Dietrich partied with Christopher Isherwood and the first gay bar in Germany was founded. Today, the gay community still revolves around Nollendorfplatz. The overground Ubahn station is even illuminated in rainbow colors, paying tribute to Schneberg's progressive past.

From some research we chose this restaurant to spend the first evening in Berlin.  Remarkable customer attention, good food. I got a really good bream and my husband tasted the schnitzel.  Quality price good! The only flaw is the "excessive" cost of water. I recommend it!!

Excellent family run restaurant with a lovely cosy atmosphere. The steak burger was one of the best my wife has ever had. Our female waitress was excellent and very attentive despite the language barrier. Definitely recommend.
Dont be put off by the slightly underwhelming exterior - the restaurant is beautiful inside,

5 minute walk from the holiday inn express, or Potsdamer platz - and what a hidden gem this is. The food is exceptional - meat is super high quality and perfectly cooked and presented. Its a chilled out, no rush, well run restaurant with great staff and a lovely ambiance.

This time much better experience, because by experience better ordered (last visit 2024 was rather a disappointing dry aged for an exaggerated price with rather (then) mediocrity...) ...this time the flambed chorizo - a must - the entrecote very well fried - not top of the line, but good steakhouse - gladly again
A sad and boring steak, but an incompetent sauce. The service was not present and no one came to the table to hear if the food was ok. Stay away.
Tender and cooked on point ! Chimichurri added a great flavor . Service was perfection! Thank you Pablo  Tasty sides ! We will be back

What an amazing restaurant the food is fantastic and the service is brilliant. We visited for my mums birthday today and they made such a fuss of her even bringing out a desert with a sparkler in. You really made her day thank you. We are visiting from the UK and will definitely recommend to our friends if they are ever visiting Berlin.

Amazing steak and great service. Had filet, sirloin and rib eye all amazing. I am fussy around steak and it was one of the best. Burger was fantastic too. Staff are so accommodating. Bread and garlic butter was to die for. Wine was great too. A must try.

We went to Asador for my partners birthday, whilst on a trip to Berlin from the UK. I had booked Asador purely on the reviews on trip advisor and Im so glad I trusted those reviews and great trip advisor score!   We go out for steak for pretty much every birthday, and I booked Asador months ago when I booked the trip to Berlin.  When we got to Asador, we were greeted by friendly staff and were immediately offered drinks and bread with a lovely garlic butter.   We both had ribeye steaks that were cooked to absolute perfection (medium rare) as well as grilled vegetables, my partner had fries and I had rosemary potatoes and we both had bearnaise sauce. I couldnt fault one single thing about the meal, it was delicious!   When I made the booking, Id added a note to say it was my partners birthday, sometimes when you go to places and theyre busy, these notes tend to get missed but not at Asador, they had seen the note, and when my partner asked for the dessert menu, a lovely and attentive member of staff (whos name Im sorry we didnt ask for!) went off and came back with dessert and a sparkler. He sung happy birthday to my partner and showed us that he cared and wanted to make the effort.   To end our meal, he gave us some limoncello, and then asked if we wanted more, as I dont really drink, I said no and then he asked if wed tried Berliner luft (a popular peppermint liqueur in Germany were told) and brought some over for us to try (this is so nice if you are reading and havent tried!)   As I said, I really cant fault our experience at Asador and would recommend to anyone looking for a lovely restaurant for any occasion! (Even just for a weekday dinner). We even said if this was a local restaurant to us at home, wed regularly return.   Thank you so much to the kind member of staff this evening and to all the other staff for making it an all round perfect evening.
The food here is ok. My pork was overcooked and therefore dry. The service was ok and pleasant. The wine and beer were ok. Not a five star restaurant.

Great steaks, food was amazing. Beer was good too. Only thing that we didnt like was the waiter/server had already added 10% to the bill. Not sure if this is because we where tourists or is the normal thing restaurants do in Berlin.
Great food really nice staff o a good Rioja wine World-class meat  A must if you like meat and are in Berlin

A bit boring environment. Low Service. We had an appetizer burrata but only tasted mozzarella and it was ice cold so did not taste good at all. The beef was good with good fries and good gratin. The waiter asks if we want to tip it gets uncomfortable when we don't really understand and says the amount he gets sad so we say well okay but we can tip 5% so he kind of gets mad and says do as you want so then they feel ungrateful so we pay the bill and go. We don't even get a bye when they took offense

This is the version of our website addressed to speakers of English in the United States. If you are a resident of another country or region, please select the appropriate version of Tripadvisor for your country or region in the drop-down menu.
Such a nice idea for a caf and the selection of Germknodel so diverse. We ordered once sweet and once savoury. Both variations tasted extremely delicious. A clear recommendation and gladly again
Innovative and super taste in everything we got. Very interesting concept

Is there anything better than being so positively surprised about some food that you get the desire for a adopt the concept. Very innovative and exciting food, always nice to experience something you've never had before

We didn't know what it was, and we still don't know about it, a bowl/ maybe pasta dough, steamed, probably not baked, it was soft and delicious with super fill. Nice service, fast serving, extremely reasonable price, the salad was also really nice. I mean a glass of red wine had done wonders, my caffe latte, didn't really fit, next time I buy water. The coffee was really good, but should have been dessert, and not for my goat cheese kndel.

Cute little and loving shop whose name is program. The food is impeccable, makes you happy because fluffy and delicious. The care is wonderful, very attentive-it doesn't get better. Come back. Thanks for the wonderful lunch.

Happened by this restaurant and decided to give dumplings a try. These are stuffed with various veggy concotions and nicely served up with an accompanying sauce - so nicely presented. We three had different dishes and tasted each other's meal and declared all to be delicious. A must when we're back in Berlin.

Like many others who've written reviews, we were surprised to find that steamed buns (bao) are very tasty. We guzzled savory buns with walnut and with chipotle filling, followed by a honey bun with poppy seeds (we shared). The dressings were excellent and despite the smallish size, we were happily filled up. The two young women serving seemed to do an excellent job. There's lots of light and space in the resto, which also has a wall decorated with buns. Get happy!

As not a big fan of dumplings- i was a bit scared going to have a meal here. But- when i saw the place, big smiles, nice flowers- all was good. And then- the menu!!! So small, but also- enough for everyone. Drinks, sweet and salty versions of dumplings. Awesome experience and nice lunch.

Hppies is a restaurant in Berlin that serves steamed buns with unique fillings, both savory and sweet. Reviewers rave about the food and service, especially recommending the dumplings with blue cheese and pear or lentils.

Spacious new location where it is now a little easier to get a seat and only a stone's throw away from the old shop :)  Hppies are and will remain the best yeast dumplings I have ever eaten in my life. Made with passion and you can taste it.  So nice that Hppies is finally back. 2023 was just missing something without you.

We were introduced to Happies by a food tour guide. Wonderfully unique, like nothing weve ever eaten before. Sort of a steamed Asian Bao bun filled with savory (or sweet) fillings, topped with a variety of nuts, berries, and/or sauces. So good in fact that we returned the following day for lunch on our own. Add to the quality of the food the love and attention of the staff and owner. This place is simply brilliant, and Happy

We absolutely love Hppies. This was our 4th visit at this tiny little place - and a "must-visit" whenever we are i Berlin. The germkndels are just perfect, tasty and beautiful - and the owner and her staff are so friendly and altogether lovely people. A trip to berlin without a Hppies is just not right - so we will se you again somewhere in Berlin

Denoted in Prenzlauer Berg by a couple outside tables and their Zoloft-reminiscent mascot hppies exudes joy in the form of creative globally-inspired Dumplings served at fair prices from a gracious staff.  Not the Germkndeln of old, though a Dessert Bun named Netti puts Spiced Plum and Austrian Poppyseeds front and center in Brown Butter, hppies offerings are all Vegetarian and served with Salad with one enough for a snack and two plenty for most as a meal.  Prone to weekend sell-outs of top items, though pre-orders and take-out are available, it is amidst clean white surroundings that diners huddle over Coffee or Housemade Lemonade while digging into flavors like Mathias Soy, Figs and Chilies or the Lentil-loaded Krische served with Chutney, Yogurt and Papadam.  7,00 to 8,50 apiece, not cheap but quite affordable considering portions and products involved, youngsters are invited to indulge in Pizza-riffing Julia that can be upgraded by Pesto while everyone would be wise to order one of owner Uli Marschners Dani that dazzles like Strawberry Shortcake infused with Peppercorns and a hint of acidity from aged Balsamic.

1 kind of dish... infinite possibilities, very unique combinations from cuisines all around the world, super sweet service and please don't pass on the funky lemonade... it will get you somewhat happy and high ;))

What a find - thanks to TripAdvisor for the recommendation. A bit of a walk from the centre but a very pleasant one taking you through the lovely Prenzlauer Berg.   It's a tiny cafe with a very warm welcome, lovely flowers and fun cartoons on the walls, serving variations on the same theme - Austrian yeast dumplings, with different savoury and sweet fillings. We had one with kimchi and another with spicy lentils and chutney, and had to leave room for the sweet ones - the Netti, with stewed plums, poppy seeds and brown butter was one of the nicest things I have ever eaten.   Drinks were also lovely and staff could not have been lovelier.b

Digital Payments, Accepts credit cards: American Express, Discover, Mastercard, Visa
Could you tell me if the closing time is really 10pm and if so, is the last bookable time or kicking out time please? TIA

I celebrated my birthday with a group of friends and relatives at Restaurant Ebert on January 20, 2026.   The four-course menu was excellent. Everyone was thrilled. The service was perfect, especially Mrs. Ebert was a very nice hostess and responded to all wishes. Even the normal opening hours were exceeded, because on January 21st it was my sister's birthday.  I can only recommend the restaurant. The next time we visit Berlin we will be happy to come back.
What a great place! Super nice and attentive staff, great food and excellent atmosphere in a quiet suburb of Berlin. Do not miss out if you are in Berlin.

here everything is just right - the food a revelation, the ambience just pleasant and the service as always great - today was my birthday dinner here once again and I couldn't ask for a nicer gift. thanks to the Ebert with his entire crew :-) Christine

I come to the Ebert very often with business partners, friends and family and everyone is enthusiastic - it's just a safe address for best food and good service - here the price-performance quality is right - not so often found in Berlin at the moment!  Thanks to the Ebert team!

Like every year, I went out to eat gas with a friend. Due to positive reviews we ended up in the Ebert. The corner restaurant is "neat" with adequate table linen. The placement took despite reservation. The service is superficially friendly. Now to the goose. The roast goose is no bargain at 44 euros. You get asked chest or club. A table must share half a goose. I had helped decide for the club. A leg smaller than a chicken leg was then served. I'd never seen anything like it. Next to it was a rag with skin. The meat was moderate. Due to the small club tough, the flesh of the rag difficult. When roasting goose, you look forward to crispy skin. That's what we searched for in vain. The announced apple with cranberries was cold and hard. Then it became unfortunate. Contact with service. He told us that the apple was just decoration and had always been served cold for 37 years. Aha, how the restaurant then makes it into the recommendations is unclear. The service had further denied that the club was unusually small. Otherwise they wouldn't have been extradited, Aha. The customer is presented as a moron, you shouldn't do that. The side dishes clove and herb were ok. Overall, we will visit another restaurant next year. I wonder what happened to top-class gastronomy. Unfortunately, only the price is right.
Service and food were not special and too expensive what was offered. Tortellini tasted of garlic and portion was moderate. Zurich squirreled was nothing special either. Rstli wasn't fried through.

We were again in the restaurant Ebert. While previous visits did not give rise to complaints, this time it was the opposite. We had plaice with fried potatoes and veal schnitzel with asparagus.The fried potatoes soft and cardboard the plaice very thin, consisted mainly of breadcrumbs. The asparagus should have been in the boiling water for a few minutes longer, so the asparagus was still too hard, could hardly be cut with the blunt knife. It also lacked the pinch of sugar; which is actually added to the boiling water. The two small, thin veal chips lacked the spice, tasted bland. Cranberries would have done the meat good. To mention the price of veal cutlets with Beelitzer asparagus: 41,00 Euro ! We haven't eaten so badly in a long time.

Attractive atmosphere, nice service. Starter: Potato soup, totally in the style of homemaker kind. So far ok, but the price of 10 euros is more spiced than the soup and lacks a little taste kick. The starter "Bried Blood Sausage" is spiced up to the main course for a fair 25 euros. My question about mustard darkens the face of the waitress. "Good sauce," she says, "just try it like that." Yes, sir. Mustard is not necessary. I would have brought it anyway. A disappointment the marzipan cream brule. A little blob of cold cream. My objection, that it is precisely the combination of warm caramel layer and unheated cream that makes the appeal, is blown away: The chef would go over the shift with the Bunsen burner before it was sent. This shift here has never seen a burner! However, the sour cherries, whose raison dtre is not completely obvious to me, are boiling hot. Maybe the chef just slipped? Bottom line: good. Good enough to come back? I don't know yet.
What a find. Family owned and run. Very friendly with great food. We went Sunday night which was a special Italian night alongside the usual menu. Excellent value. Would definitely go again.

Situated a bit away from the hustle and bustle of a residential district, our discovery of the day is hiding:  very nice and attentive staff, a small, fine menu that was supplemented by an Austrian special menu and a kitchen that knows how to do it!  Eberts is on our favourites list for Berlin!
For a tourist, it might be an upscale German restaurant, but we were disappointed by the not outstanding food nor service. Look further, you will find better places elsewhere.
One of the best Culinary evenings ever! Go to Eberts family run for 40 years and totally amazing!

Just home from an absolutely fantastic evening. The food, recipes from Mr Wannermacher ( had a michelin star for many years) was beautifully prepared, cooked, presented and served. The Salmon in the Starter had a consistence I have never had before, it was delicious. The Lobster Bisque was the best I have ever had, I could have bathed in it! Flank steak excellent and the desert was a mixture of the best chocolate moise and passion fruit gel and semi fredo, a perfect balance of two tastes. Thank you for this wonderful experience!
A great restaurant, very cozy, great dishes, great quality. I highly recommend it. We will definitely come back!

This is what you expect from a contemporary German food.  Food is very nice, service is flawless, atmosphere very familiar.  Pan fried pikeperch with pan fried potatoes was just too much fried combination.   Otherwise only recommendation!

The service was nice and accommodating, especially given the restaurant staffed to the last table. Unfortunately, the quality of the food dropped significantly. We ate martinsgans menu. The foie gras pie was very tasty, the vegetable broth that followed unfortunately only lukewarm. The goose was very bad, because of the sauce already prepared on the plate it was not very crusty, the knives were unfortunately not sharp enough, so the division was very difficult. Red cabbage and kale were acceptable, so were dumplings. All in all acceptable, but not a great experience, which hurts in the face of great demand. In addition, the noise level was very high, so talking about the table was almost impossible, but we were there for dinner as well. Perhaps our expectations were too high, as we had assumed the Other level of the restaurant.

Wie weit ist der Admiralspalast entfernt? Zu fu Danke Lydia 017660863455

Always love coming here when in Berlin, traditional German pub. Great menu, delicious German food, great beer, wonderful interior, ambiance and atmosphere (can get lively), and not forgetting the friendly polite service. To avoid being disappointed book in advance, its a great place.

Excellent value for money. Great atmosphere. Good standard of typical Berlin cuisine - even German-. Excellent deal. Very good ambient music. The crook and the Wiener Schnitzel really excellent. The best I've ever tasted in Germany.
What a quaint pub! The staff with heart in the right place, plus the typical Berlin muzzle.  The food was delicious, who likes it hearty, is absolutely right here!

A nice Welcoming and a good table for a small and atypical establishment in this very impersonal neighborhood. At the hotel right next door, I enjoyed being able to find a personal place and away from "groups".

Visited on our first evening after a seven hour train journey from Gdansk.  Arrived at 7pm and the few tables outside were taken but we had a table inside next to the open window looking onto the street.  For our first visit to Germany what else could we try but currywurst - and it was really enjoyable.
Very good restaurant with German cuisine. The dishes are excellent and very hearty. It offers a wide range of German beers.  I recommend this restaurant!
A real original what the Berliner Schnauze has with a lot of heart.  We loved the food and the quaint atmosphere. Always happy to. Just Topp
What a great place. So much so that we went twice. Very friendly staff. Great traditional food and a fine array of beers.great place

We were looking for traditional german restaurant and we found this. It is a german pub that served authentic german food and alcohol. We had a Berliner pilsner beer and a currywurst to eat. The place seems pretty touristic but food seems authentic.

On my way to the ATM I passed this restaurant (its a block from hotel chateau Royal) and I saw a guy eating the schnitzel. My mouth immediately started to water. The next night, I insisted that we go there for dinner. We were not disappointed!  Hubby had the schnitzel (it was better than it looked) with creamed mushrooms, fried potatoes and sauerkraut. I had the bratwurst with mashed potatoes, gravy and sauerkraut. The schnitzel was crispy on the outside and oh so tender on the inside. The creamed mushrooms and fried potatoes were good Im assuming (I didnt have a bite). The brats were amazing-and considering I was raised in them in WI that compliment is hard to give. They were juicy and sliced just right. The mashed potatoes and gravy were out of this worldI dont eat them often but I almost cleaned the plate (and portions were ample)  Im devoting an entire paragraph to the sauerkraut. I love the stuff we get in the USusually I buy a high end German specialty brand in a jar. HOWEVERthe Poles and Germans do something different (and very special) with their sauerkraut here in Eastern Europe. First of all it has carrots in it. Secondly it isnt as tangy as what we get in the states. Its almost creamy. The Poles put very finely minced sausage in theirs. Anyway.IT IS DEVINE. we bought a polish cookbook just to try to replicate it! We dont get home for 3 more weeks. Hope my tastebuds remember the flavor when we get home to AZ (not that Ill be rushing to make sauerkraut and brats when its 110!!)  Anywaydo what you can to eat at this place. Foods is amazing. So are the beers and service!!!  We returned tonight and had small plates. Fried meatball for me (with sauerkraut of course) and hubby had two sausages (one bologna and one something else) and a meatball. Both were amazing as always. Were here two more nights. If we go backIm totem between the schnitzel and the brats!!!

Those who like solid home cooking and a well-kept Pilsener on tap are in good hands here and will not be disappointed. The host is friendly. International audience due to the central location.  The Berlin meeting point is a recommendation.

Very friendly welcome, the room is nice and you can also eat out. The menu offers various meat, poultry, fish, vegetarian dishes. Order taking and service are fast. The staff is very attentive. Plates are hearty, good and well presented. The wine is good. Beers, too. I recommend currywurst and herring fillets. Vegetables are delicious and potatoes are very well cooked. Do not hesitate to enjoy a kummel berliner at the end of the meal. It's delicious. I have been there twice in three days Very reasonable prices in this tourist area. I recommend.
Unfriendly Auntie. The Pepsi Max that no longer contained carbonation was considered ordinary. The young lady behind the bar tried to make this right. Nevertheless, not recommended.
Delicious food and great beer in a cozy setting. The schnitzel (fried pork cutlet with corn flakes) is highly recommended, and the apple strudel is outstanding.

Excellent German pub with a great range of beer. Fit us in without reservation. Very authentic German menu, somewhat limited range of foods. We ordered a pork knuckle each - it took longer than the 30 minutes advertised but was worth the wait! Shame the portion was so large, we probably couldve shared one to prevent wastage but it was delicious. Absolutely recommend.
